Reviews.Title: GREAT underwater/MACRO camera
Reviews.Author: qbc1899
Reviews.Content: I bought this product for an upcoming trip to Hawaii and wanted a camera with underwater capability.  I also bought the Panasonic Lumix TS3 to compare and ended up returning it.  I am happy with my choice to keep the Pentax.Here is what I liked:The durability and the rugged feel of this camera right away impressed me.  I felt like I was holding a camera that wouldn't break if I dropped it or tossed it into my purse.  It was exactly what I needed for an outdoor/adventure trip.  I was most excited to try out the Macro capabilities of this camera.  They were among the first shots I took.  All I can say is that they were amazing.  Far and away, the quality was better than anything I have seen for a Point and Shoot camera.  I could see individual bits of pollen when shooting a flower or individual pores on my finger.  Even when I blew the images up and zoomed in, the clarity was amazing.Once I got onto my trip, I used the camera underwater in various depths, from 3 feet of water to 250 (although I did not go down that far, this camera is only waterproof to 30 feet).  The clarity of the images while zooming in in deep in water was great.  I took a picture of a puffer fish that was close to 100 feet below me in 250 feet of water and the image turned out.  I took pictures of sharks, dolphins, fish and coral.  The pictures are clear and vibrant.  The macro setting on some of the coral is to die for.  I was so impressed with how these turned out.  Had no problems with the camera being waterproof.  After each underwater adventure (lasting from 20 minutes to two hours in the water, diving up to 20-25 feet deep for some pictures), I rinsed the camera with clean water and let it air dry before I opened any compartments.  The color quality is spot on, no weird colors turning up.  It is true to eye.  The buttons are also easy to use and change to the best setting (outside, underwater, macro, auto, sport, etc).  All of my pictures in daylight and soft light turned out great.  The large screen on the back makes viewing pictures easy.  The self-portrait assist was a cool idea and worked great.Negatives:The only thing that I was NOT impressed with on this camera was low light (nighttime, inside)/no light (nighttime, outside) conditions.  Whenever it was dark out, the pictures often turned out blurry, even with the flash on.  I may have had it on the wrong setting, because some of them turned out great, but others, not so great.  Or it may have been user error (whenever I took the pictures, they generally turned out fine, the ones that are blurry tend to be when I asked random people to take a picture of me).  I didn't play around with the settings at night too much mostly because I had a DSLR camera with me that I used in those conditions.  I did take a lot of sunset pictures that turned out great on this camera.  But once the sun was down....not so much.  Also, I went for a night dive with this camera, the underwater camera is useless at night because the flash captures particles in the water and with no flash it's too blurry.  However, the underwater video recorder worked great at night.Overall, this is a great camera for it's price.  The camera performs well under most conditions.  I lugged it around on a dusty six mile hike, underwater, running, and everything else you can imagine.  The camera is easy to wash off, waterproof and has a FANTASTIC macro ability that I have never seen on a point and shoot camera before.  If you are expecting this to be a DSLR, remember that this is a POINT AND SHOOT camera.  Even so, some of the pictures rivaled my DSLR camera.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very entertaining WG-1
Reviews.Author: Dustin Geurts "dustin geurts"
Reviews.Content: Check out my updating youtube videos. I am user: "PentaxWG1" The good the bad the ugly. The over all feel of this camera is strong and gripable. I love having metal and rubber on my electronics. I have dropped this camera. It was on my lap in the jeep and there was a hornet. I jumped out and it threw to the ground. No problems. The removable circle around the lens (macro stand) has threads. They are 46mm and can screw on filters and caps. I got a cap, uv filter, polorized filter, and flourecent filter on e-bay for $6. So other than the sony TX10, this is the only camera that can protect the lens. Can't wait to buy a telescopic lens. My camera has been underwater about 15 ft. I've seen no problems with leaking. It has two openeings; one for battery and sd card, and one for hd/av hook-up. Both seem strong and sturdy to me. Battery cover does move ever so slightly but seems fine. Ok, thats the construction. As you have already heard, the macro/super macro is awesome. If you can get your specimen to sit still, you can get some pretty great material. The movie macro is even pretty cool, but you have to stay at a consistant focal length or it gets blury. I recorded a wolf spider in pitch black and the l.e.d. lights around the lens made it look like a monster movie! One bad thing about the macro is that when set straight down on the subject it will focus and take the picture on something as flat as a leaf or picture.... if it protrudes as much as a dime width or more it won't stay focused. But when I pulled back just a hair the dime did look awsome. N-E-Wayz, It seems the closer you are to the subject with this camera the better it looks. A closer shot of two people, shoulders and up, look really good. But further away not so much. pictures of groups of people (full body) or the shot of a pond or a... cow...I say the camera is about par. Not bad but not great. I have tried the cybershot TX10 and if you strictly want waterproof picture quality go that way or panasonic. TX10 was beautiful but not as fun. Back to the WG-1. With par pics I do feel the camera is more consistant than its predesessor w90. Better with stand, free hand not as good..but always the same. Never a crappy picture out of nowhere. I also feel it does much better in lower light than the w90. It gets noisey but I was getting decent lighted shots (no flash) in areas that where very dim to the naked eye. The l.e.d. lights are handy, too. Optical zoom works pretty well for pictures. You'll want a steady hand or stand if zoomed all the way in. Digital zoom sucks. The panorama is not sweep. You take 3 pics and line them up, then the camera stitches them. Not as convinient as the TX10 but it looks good and you can do tricks...As for underwater. Pictures and video where pretty darn good. Anti shake or wudever made it pretty smooth. With video underwater or above the zoom works but it doesn't refocus very well. But over all regular video was better than I expected. Once again when things are close it seems very virbrant. I got about a foot from a cow's face and the fur on his head got very HiDef-ish. Battery life....sucks, but I got and extra generic one when I ordered mine for 6 bucks. Over-all I really love this camera. I've been totally entertained for 2 days and havn't even gotten to time lapse phtography yet. Although I do think of the pic quality of the TX10 now and then. I would have been bored with that camera after one dip in the lake. I can get a 10 mp zoom camera for less than a hundred and fill in anywhere the wg-1 lack.

Reviews.Title: Do not waste your money on this camera
Reviews.Author: lolligag
Reviews.Content: We owned a Pentax's first waterproof camera (Optio W10) and loved it. So when it came time to upgrade we bought this one before our trip to Mexico. We choose this one because of its ergonomic design. We figured this would work wonders when splashing around underwater and be easy to hold onto. The ergonomic design is the only redeeming feature of this camera.At first we were concerned about how loose the battery door was. The battery door stayed shut but it would slide partially open when closed and was very loose (not enough for water to actually get in but enough to make us concerned). Thinking it might just be the camera we picked up, we went back to the store where we bought it from. After looking at other ones it appears to be part of the design. This should have been our first clue that this is a horrible camera.While on vacation in Mexico the camera froze several times requiring the battery to be removed to get it to unfreeze. Now this can be a true problem when you need to let the camera dry for about an hour before opening the battery door otherwise you risk exposing both the battery and memory card to water.We also discovered small water spots on the inside of the display screen. Clearly it is not as waterproof as claimed. I am glad we were only using it while wading in the ocean and not actually snorkelling.The battery life is extremely poor requiring charging every two days when the camera is moderately used.We also found the image quality not that good. After returning from our vacation, we looked at old images from our previous camera (Optio W10) and they were much better even though it was only 6 megapixels. In fact the same picture taken with our iPhone 3Gs had a better image quality.Pros- Great rugged looking designCons- Poor image quality- Freezes- Not completely waterproof- Poorly manufacturedSummaryClearly Pentax designed a nice looking camera that gives the illusion of ruggedness; however, their production quality of this model is extremely poor. We've returned the camera and are looking for a different one (not from Pentax) to replace it with.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: JLmike7
Reviews.Content: The most fantasticly durrible camera I have ever seen.  I have litterally tossed this thing around just for the fun of it, and it withstands anything.Performs great underwater.  A few bubbles come out of the power button which scared me at first, but it's normal.The battery charges only through an external charger (so it can have less waterproof ports I suppose)I am using a 16gb SD card which works great in it.  Screen is comfortably large and bright.Digital microscope blew my mind with the clarity and detail that can be achieved.  Zoom is reasonable.Pictures have a dramatic feel to them with great contrast.Software is easy to use, and took me about an hour to know every feature.  Great photo editing software is BUILT INTO THE CAMERA to do whatever effects you need done.Self-portrait mode is a little bit flaky but very interesting none the less.  Who uses facial recognition anyway, really?  lol.The feel of the camera is phenomenal.  Rubber and very hard grippy plastic cover the whole camera, and gives a very rugged and tough feel, but it is such a tiny lightweight package.Manual zoom, focus, aperture, and ISO come in very handy.All in all a fantastic camera, worth every penny. :)

Reviews.Title: Awesome All Around Camera
Reviews.Author: michael bradley
Reviews.Content: I am currently deployed to Afghanistan and I am around some rough terrain all the time with different conditions. Hot, Dusty, Cold, Wet, Rocky and this camera hasnt stopped working yet. I have dropped it from about 8 feet high off of a vehicle and yeah it is scratched but still works perfect. I have had it get wet but havn't used it submerged in water for a period of time yet. But I will. So far everything is awesome. I especially like the Safety clip it comes with. I think that was a great idea but I would suggest possibly upgrading the clip if you are a big outdoorsmen. Other than all of that it is awesome and totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for what it is
Reviews.Author: Russ Mc
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my wife (who is a photographer with a high end camera) for her to have a tough point and shoot to play around with. I haven't tested it underwater or really given it any abuse yet, but it seems to be built very sturdy. Feels good in the hand too. Cool rugged looks as well. The only negatives I can see are that the caribiner that comes with the camera is cheap, cheap, cheap, and of course the picture quality is probably about what you would expect from a fair quailty regular point and shoot. Lots of not so sharp pictures, color is often not true as well. Ocassionally it will take a picture that is right on, but it is the exception. I wasn't expecting superb picture quality, but I hoped for a little more consistency. If you are not a "photographer" you should absolutely love this camera. If you have an eye for it, then just don't expect much out of the picture quality.Overall I would recommend this as a great camera for those times you don't want to bring an SLR or a high end point and shoot, like at a beach, pool, lake, desert, etc. This certainly shouldn't be your only camera though.

Reviews.Title: Two big problems: fluorescent lights and video
Reviews.Author: M. Cordoba "mxc"
Reviews.Content: Just a note about myself that is relevant to this review: I own a DSLR and have owned many point and shoot cameras, I am well versed in using a camera (iso, aperture, shutter speed, white balance, etc)Pros:- Very good pictures under sunny and outdoor conditions (it saturates greens/blues so the pictures have quite a punch, but honestly in a positive way) this is really the best part of the camera, you can take it to the beach without worrying too much, or to the jungle (I went to the Amazon River with this camera) and the pictures for the most part were great.- Smaller than it looks, easy to carry- It takes pictures faster than a lot of other point and shoots- rugged feel with glass sunken in, so you'll never accidentally hit the lens unless you stick a thin object in there.- waterproof (they note that you have to change the rubber seals every year to keep the waterproofing working)Neutral:- glass is always exposed, which seems rather strange and maybe damaging for the camera. Most cameras either come with a cap, or close/hide. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and say it's so rugged that it doesn't matter.Cons:- Absolutely terrible, unusable pictures under fluorescent lights (automatic setting is terrible, I tried various manual settings and got it a little better, but still unusable pictures, I don't think I've seen a worse camera under this conditions - with flash it was a little better for close things, but in general this is the camera's biggest weakness.- Video is terrible too. But this time even under the best sunny conditions, it is grainy and shaky even with image stabilization on. It is so terrible that even watching it in a small screen (much less than HD) it looks grainy.A cellphone (I took side by side shots with my samsung epic 4g) takes much, much better pictures under fluorescent lights than this camera. This was basically the reason I returned the camera, it was meant to replace completely another point and shoot, not just for outdoor sunny adventures. And seeing a cellphone handle the white balance so much better than this camera's auto setting and even manually optimizing and playing extensively with the white balance to make it work in this lighting - was what ultimately convinced me to return it.The only way I would recommend this camera is if you plan on taking pictures on the beach or out in the sun, and have another DSLR or point and shoot for any indoor activities. And you don't care for video, since even under the best conditions it was terribly grainy and the image stabilization doesn't seem to do anything for videos.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 15 days
Reviews.Author: LF
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter purchased this camera for use. She saved her money and we ordered it & paid extra for 2 day shipping so she would have it for summer vacation. It worked great and the pictures were clear and the color excellent, for the first 15 days. Then she used it underwater at a pool no more than a few feet. It had condensaion in the screen and the flash area the next morning. I called Pentax and they were very laid back and told me to ship it back (at my expense) and they would check it and repair or replace it in 5 weeks. This item was less than 30 days old. (The best estimated turn around time is 5 weeks.) Summer vaction will be over in 5 weeks and she spent almost $300.00 to have no camera.  I am more disappointed in PENTAX for their poor customer service!Pentax Optio WG-1 Adventure Series 14 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom (Purple)

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio WG-1 Lousy Photos
Reviews.Author: SGK
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Amazon back on April 23, 2011 for $319.00 only to find it available on Amazon a few weeks later for $285.00 and again for $272.  I have owned several digital point and shoot cameras and 35 mm cameras over the years including the older digital Pentax Optio WP 30.  The Optio WP 30 was a MUCH BETTER camera as far as photo quality! I consider myself a very good amateur photographer. Although the Pentax WG-1 camera seems to be rugged and waterproof, I find the photo quality very poor on every setting I tried.  The camera came without a warranty card so I am wondering if this was a previous return.  The camera's daylight photos were not sharp at 14 mp and at 5 mp. Colors were faded, inconsistent or appeared to have a lot of "noise" on all settings. The nighttime outdoor/indoor as well as lowlight shots were even worse with or without a flash. It doesn't seem to focus well in both daylight and nighttime shots. Photos were NOT SHARP! I'm not sure if this particular camera is defective but I am sending it back to Amazon for a refund.Pros = Looks rugged & feels good in hand.  I was really hoping that this would be my outdoor goto camera because I like the way it looks and feels but...Cons = Looks aren't everything. Poor photo quality, poor focusing, poor color saturation

Reviews.Title: My brief experience Optio WG-1 an indication of poor quality control and even worse Customer Service
Reviews.Author: jofog
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife 2 months ago after reading good reviews and comparing features. I bought it in part so she could use it for our vacation which is a month from now. The camera seemed to be working fine except that it goes through power very quickly compared to our other digitals. Then the first time my wife got it near water it failed, she took it to the beach and had a friend take photos of her while she was surfing. He was standing on the shoreline taking pics and the camera got splashed. Since then the image on the screen is totally messed up and the captured images are completely washed out and distorted. The images that were captured on the card before the splash are fine but not after.I contacted Pentax customer service to see what they could do and I was basically told that I must be lying. Based on my previous experience with Pentax' customer service I had expected better. I told this person that there were others with similar experience and she actually searched for the reviews online while I was on the phone then told me that "yes but in general the reviews weren't that bad".So this is what I have learned about this product and Pentax generally, a lot of marketing not much substance. When the products work they are pretty good when they don't they're terrible and customer service may or may not be helpful. To me this inconsistency points to serious issues with their Quality organization. It shouldn't be hit or miss. It's a shame.If you want to gamble as to whether the product you spent hundreds of dollars on will work or not then maybe Pentax is for you. If not then as sexy and alluring as these products are stay clear of Pentax.

Reviews.Title: Not designed for rugged use!
Reviews.Author: K. Melough
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera because of the outdoor appeal. It is good enough as a camera, but fails on it being a tuff outdoor or underwater camera. There is a tight seal on the battery compartment and a toggle latch that locks it. The toggle latch is very loose and will work itself to the release position. I googled this to see if I wasn't using it correctly, but instead found that I was not the only one experiencing it. This seems to be a design flaw. It's ashame as the rest of the camera is built rugged tuff, but the fear of that compartment opening up makes me gun shy about using it.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: sbmiller
Reviews.Content: Living in the Bahamas we needed a reliable underwater camera. We started with the fugifilm one and what a joke that was! I could not be happier with this camera. We have gotten some amazing underwater footage with it. It also works great as an everyday camera. I love how rugged it is. I am not afraid I will break it.

Reviews.Title: durable, reliable, excellent
Reviews.Author: kprowe
Reviews.Content: The camera is just what we were looking for. I have taken it out 10 or so times now since purchasing into 20-25 ft of water and it works great! the multiple settings as well as the way the flash is arranged helps with taking great underwater photos. I have dropped it into sand and it's durable shell protects it from scratching or having the sand get caught in a crevice. Very pleased with the camera,as well as Pentax cameras always!

Reviews.Title: Excellent as a nonprimary camera
Reviews.Author: GMGCPA "JJJJJETS"
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews...bought the camera several months ago and need to chime in...this camera gets all the dirty work where I wouldn't take my DSLR or M43...for this purpose it's excellent...it's fun to use...enable both d-range settings...indoors do not use the AWB, adjust manually to get nice low light indoor shots...leave the macro stand on all the time and get a 46mm clip on lens cover...battery life is good but always keep a back up handy...get a zing or tenba case and trust the night scene settings nightime for some really nice shots...built like a tank...feels great in the hand...play with these manual adjustments and you will get rewarded...

Reviews.Title: happy so far
Reviews.Author: PENnameIS
Reviews.Content: it's a pretty fun digital camera. The digital microscope mode allows for some pretty/odd pictures depending on what you shoot with it.  Big con is the digital zoom looks horrid, it doesn't seem to want to focus, but the optical zoom is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Aruel D. Almoguer Lopez "wickED_dude"
Reviews.Content: This camera is really great and small! i've had it for about 10 days now, and have taken it on my wicked adventures! it's a great camera! i love the pictures it takes! granted, they may not be as good as those of a $1500 dslr, but the main difference is i can take this with me wherever i go. i took it climbing last weekend and didnt worry about it getting wet or hitting rocks the rock surface...it was great.The only thing I dont like about it is that the lense is only covered by what i assume is strong plexiglass, but no metal over over it so i always use this camera with the macro stand on (and im not trying to find a filter for it; that way it will add some protection to the lense cover.

Reviews.Title: 6 pictures and then DEAD
Reviews.Author: M. Grant
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my trip to Cancun.  On the first day, I took the camera to the pool and took 6 pictures just to test the camera.  The pictures were clear and good looking.  The camera was easy to use, especially underwater and I was excited about the next day's snorkeling trip.  I found all the functions worked as advertised and was even happy with the way the camera handled some low light issues.The next day I took the camera on the snorkeling trip and when I turned it on, the view screen would not come on.  I could not tell if the camera was taking pictures (found out later it was) since the view screen was blank.  I tried everything to get to the camera to come on, but it would not.  After we finished snorkeling in two beautiful locations, I decided to give the camera one last chance as we snorkeled in a lagoon, to my amazement, the camera came on.  I took two pictures and then the view screen went blank again.  I shut the camera off and on three times and the view screen came back on.  Long story short, I was able to take 8 more pictures over the next 2 hours.  I was very upset and disappointed.What I found out was that, even with the view screen not working, the camera was taking pictures.  Since there was no way to frame the pictures, with the view screen off, those pictures were blurry and off center.I would have loved for this camera to work as advertised but, it didn't.  I wouldn't say you should not buy this camera, perhaps I got a lemon but, I won't risk the money again.

Reviews.Title: Really disappointed with this camera on so many levels...
Reviews.Author: KindlePad
Reviews.Content: (updated on May 6, 2011)I am trying to find a P&S; camera that takes very good HD video and stills without fuss. As summers can be brutal here, we spend a lot of time at the beach, lake or in the pool. It makes sense for me to have a waterproof camera so I don't subject my DSLR to those conditions. I want a single camera that I can take on vacation and shoot stills and video and have reasonably good results. I want it to be waterproof and pocket-sized so I don't have to lug the camera bag with me or worry about getting it stolen. I understand the images won't be quite as good as my Sony DSLR.I took the Pentax WG-1 for a field test while my daughter and I were walking the dog. It was a lovely spring day, not too sunny, not too overcast. Perfect light you would say. Using the autopic feature - half the shots were out of focus. Of those few that were in focus, the color varied widely from shot to shot. Overall the shots were sort of washed out and faded. I tried the manual program mode and had slightly better luck but still 1 of 3 pics were blurry or soft.Other Negatives (besides the out of focus shots):Video was very shaky even with stabilization on - unusable.Video quality was extremely poor. It looked pixelated like it was up-sampled VGA - unusable.Video format is AVI?! Who the heck wants a AVI file in 2011? MPG at least or MP4 preferably.The microscope mode also has focus problems. When you half press to set the pic, it looks great. But when you actually take the pic, it comes out very blurry. Even with the 4 lights on.It uses a battery charger that looks like it should plug straight into the wall - but instead you get a long, heavy cable that plugs into the charger & then the wall. This makes it very inconvenient for travel. Many cameras today come with a single wall charger - this one has a 2 piece charger. That makes a difference when traveling.Positives:It looks neat & has a cool rubberized grippy feel. People will go "ooohhh" when they see it.Simple, logical button and interface layout. Will help for using the camera underwater or in adverse conditions.Final Assessment: the cool stylish look of the camera doesn't make up for the focus problems, the unacceptable low quality video and often unusable still pictures.-----------May 6th 2011 Update: I am returning this camera to Amazon. Read comments below for a comparison to another waterproof camera I ordered and tested.

Reviews.Title: Great overall camera
Reviews.Author: Ataman
Reviews.Content: Pros: very well built camera, waterproof as advertised, decent pics quality.Cons: annoying shutter lag.this camera reminded me of olympus 850sw i used to own - decent durable camera, of course it won't produce dslr-like images, but if you need a small pocket camera you can take with you nearly everywhere - i think this one is your best choice on the market right now. Panasonic ts1/2/3 are actually better in terms of performance, but i had two of them leak in 6 to 10 feet of water on the first or second day of use, and third one gave out in about 6 month of regular use, no water. i find that unacceptable - after all, this type of cameras are bought for the adventure-minded people - and durability and reliability must be an absolute requirement before even getting into performance ratings.i wanted to see how deep this camera will work - took it on two dives, even though 33foot depth rating limits it to some advanced snorkeling, but it actually worked surprisingly well - did not leak at all, even though i took it down to 45-50 feet for half an hour twice. the only problem i had at that depth was the power button got "pressed in" by the water pressure, and camera would not turn on anymore until i took up closer to the surface. i would give this camera 6 stars for durability if i could.but the annoying part of it is shutter lag - it is very noticeable - good luck trying to take a pic of some fish swimming by... very frustrating. i was limited pretty much to taking pics of corals and such. i really hope pentax will fix this problem in the next version of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Terrible video quality, otherwise a good camera
Reviews.Author: lookaught
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the durability. I shoot a lot of pics and also a lot of videos, and frankly, the video quality is awful. My old iphone 3GS shot better video, and the new 4GS shoots MUCH better video. This camera simply takes very grainy video, regardless of the settings.Picture quality is very good, which is why it is surprising that the video is so bad. I suppose that if you want really good video and a waterproof camera, get a GoPro. If you only plan on using this camera for photos, then it is a good choice for the outdoors.If I were not beyond my return period I would return it.

Reviews.Title: Great ruggedized Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Burns
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about this camera because of some of the reviews but overall it seemed the best fit for my needs. I am so glad I bought this camera it does everything it claims to. I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great Overall Camera
Reviews.Author: Patrick McDonough
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Pentax WG-1 camera about a month ago before I took a trip to the beach. After researching this camera for a while I decided it would be the perfect one for me. Previous point and shoot cameras that I have owned ended up breaking due to the lense opening while in my pocket. That was one main feature that attracted me to this product, which was that the lense didnt protrude out and that it was a very rugged and durable camera. I used this camera extensively while at the beach. In and out of the water, in the pool, ocean, sandy beach, humid weather and it worked great. I love the underwater feature, it worked great and there were no signs of leakage even after multiple uses in the water. I also enjoy using all the different features on this camera such as the panoramic, 1cm macro, and on camera photo editing. It also took decent videos outside except for when there was a sunny glare off the water, it caused the video to look like it was shot using a super 8 camera (old time and grainy). It's an awesome everyday point and shoot camera that can be taken anywhere. Obviously the pictures taken with this camera dont compare to using my Nikon D5000, but that's only expected. If i know I want to take a high quality picture, I will switch cameras. Otherwise I enjoy using this one daily.Pros:-compact and durable-waterproof-on camera photo editing-cool featurescons:-low light situations-video while really sunny

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Adam Rooney
Reviews.Content: I was seeking durable camera I could use for day trips with my children, such as the beach or amusement parks. I grew tired of toting around a full size SLR (Canon) and separate digital video camera (FlipVideo). I love both of those cameras but they were just too inconvenient for regular use in busy environments, I needed something I could carry in my pocket and to snap what I what, whenever I need to. After 3 weeks of use, including a week long stay on the beach, some historical touring, back yard parties and a day at six flags, this camera is a true performer.My criteria was probably only a bit aggressive. I was looking for:1. pocket size2. good battery (I previously had a canon powershot pocket camera with awful battery life)3. High Resolution - 10MP+4. HD Video5. Water-Proof (we have a waterproof case for our Flip, and use it all the time!)6. Fast shooting speedThis Pentax camera answered all of the above and more. Here is what I got1. pocket size - obviously! And the caribiner is great too!2. good battery - awesome. Lasted 2 days at a time on vacation, roughly 300 shots per charge including shooting videos. At no time did I feel I needed to manage my power consumption conservatively.3. High Resolution - 14 MP, gives me plenty of real estate for cropping and unwanted elements while retaining high res of my subject.4. HD Video - It is not as good as the flip but it is good enough. There is slightly more digital blur on fast motion than you would get with a FlipVideo.5. Water-Proof - works great. I have shot both video and still photos so far and the quality has been amazing. In some photos you cannot even tell you are underwater.6. Fast shooting speed - This is obviously not and SLR camera, but overall the speed was good enough. The start-up time is very fast and the auto-focus is pretty quick.Other observations*The photo quality is very good for a pocket camera. Keeping in mind that the lens is pretty tiny, I was impressed with the the overall results.*With the camera set to auto, sometimes it chooses the wrong mode, such as failing to fire the flash in a low light scene. I found that re-shooting the shot again typically fixed this. I'm not sure if this is a firmware issue or just something that happens.*Smile detection works and is fun! It was a great was to let small children (age 2) take photos without having to learn how to use the buttons. You just have to point the camera at a person and the shutter will fire when the subject(s) smile!*Burst works OK. There are 2 burst modes. The high res mode takes full 14 megapixel photos at a rate a 1 per second, and the quality is still pretty good. With the caveat that while the burst is going on, the screen is only showing you the previous shot, not the current target, and there is no view finder aside from the screen. So trying to shoot a moving subject can be tricky. My solution was to zoom out a bit and do my best to follow the subject as best I could once the burst starts. This worked pretty well, because at 14 megapixel, I could still crop alot out of the zoomed out photo and end up with a great shot. There is also a high speed burst mode but that only take 5 MP images, and they were generally horrible. Of course neither burst mode allows for a flash so it can really only be used outside.Overall I am very pleased with this purchase. The price was super low and the results have been great. With a 16GB SD Card, I can't image any situation where I could fill up the whole thing, even considering how many photos I typically take. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good compact camera
Reviews.Author: Atari Fan
Reviews.Content: The Pentax WG-1 is a great small camera...but, like all other cameras, it is not perfect.First of all, I got this camera to replace my Optio S (the original).  I still love that old camera and it has gone everywhere with me.  The new WG-1 is a bit larger.  However, it makes up for the size with a fully interior lens mechanism.No worries about the telescoping lens getting damaged with this new model.  The "all-internal" works is very convenient.  The camera can turn on and take picture in less than 2 seconds!  Missing a shot is much less likely with the WG-1.  So far, battery life is respectable, considering its size.The digital microscope (supermacro) is as spectacular as ever.  The little LED lights help quite a bit for the closeups.  The (regular) macro is also fantastic.  The small macro stand is threaded so you can put 46 mm filters on this camera.  Try doing that with some other brand!In regular daylight, the camera takes great pictures.  The HD video is also good (don't expect any compact camera to take video like a dedicated video camera).  The new face and smile recognition functions are great.  Frown while setting up the picture, then smile...click...the camera shoots for you!  Cool!There are a few weaknesses with this camera.  The most glaring is the ability to take low light interior shots.  If you don't use the flash, don't expect miracles.  To give credit, I compared my WG-1 with my wife's higher-end Canon PowerShot.  Her PowerShot did NOT take pictures any better than the Pentax indoors with CFL lighting.  When zoomed in, the Canon had the same poor ability for indoor shots.  However, both cameras were comparable if the flash was used.  Flash made both cameras much better.  Also, the automatic mode for interior shots are guaranteed horrible with all compacts, so learn to use the custom settings on every camera indoors.Two other things could be improved.  First of all, it would be nice if 14 megapixel pictures looked a bit better than the 5 megapixel pictures.  I cannot tell the difference most of the time.  (The same is true for Canon, too, though.)Lastly, when hooked up to an HDTV via USB, my Vizio TV cannot display the movies...an HDMI cord (not included) is required for that.  That is clearly Vizio's problem, but it would be nice if the USB worked.

Reviews.Title: Optio WG-1
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I had a Optio W80 and I am sad to say last year I lost it while tubing down the river in Eastern NC. Its probably in about 2.5 feet of water and I would assume still works. I had to get a new one but because technology moves so fast I was facing taking a chance on two versions later. I wanted a W90 but could not find any and had to go with the WG1.  I have to admit I was not that fond of the style but after using it for a few months I can honestly say it is no big deal. It is a fine camera and is good at what it does (take snap shots). I primarily shoot film as I sold all my fancy digital cameras and went back to analog. With that being said this camera excels at what it does. Takes decent digital snap shots for the necessary times ;) Its not a super brillant fancy digital point and shoot. Its an affordable (cheap) well made rugged few frills camera that is water proof, dependable and gets the job done with satisfactory results.  If you are looking for a primary camera that will take fantastic stunning photos you will be disappointed. But for what this camera is designed for its awesome and I would recommend it.  It is that camera you take with you for all those other times you wouldn't dare take your good cameras ;) I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: best waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: purchasedthe pentax wg1 waterproof camera took it to our trip to jamaica it urned out i made the right choice in purchasing this camera!Its awesome!we took it in the ocean 40 ft scuba diving snorkeling swimming pool u name it we took it there

Reviews.Title: Great Camera if...
Reviews.Author: Chan W. Cho "incubus s"
Reviews.Content: I love everything about the camera except the picture quality. Exceptional built quality and lots of nice features, especially the macro mode which is absolutely outstanding. The picture quality, however, is on par with my iphone 4, if not better. Even at 400 iso , noise is very noticeable. I have seen cameras with better results with the same 1/2.3" sensor.

Reviews.Title: Not Water Proof
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Not Water ProofI had tried 2 of these in less than 2 months - never been below 8' in the water. Both had leaked - 2nd one not bad enough to ruin camera , but only matter of time.The 2nd one the door would move the battery in such a way that it would not turn one-- Bad design on the door.

Reviews.Title: Cool functions, but beware NOT waterproof & has issues
Reviews.Author: Tim Davidson
Reviews.Content: Summary--- not truly waterproof, some focusing issues, strange problem with LED lights. Awesome functions, however.First let me preface this by saying I loved this camera (and the precursor models). There are so many cool functions, for example, the digital microscope is a brilliant idea. I am a marine biologist so I thought this was a perfect camera for field work.However, the same "leakiness" issues persist with this model.  In the first W-90's I owned (yes, I owned two of them), the camera would randomly take on water for no apparent reason. First condensation would appear in the lens and view screen and then enough water clearly got in to fry the camera. At the time I didn't quite realize the condensation was indicative of flooding and was too wrapped up in the cool coral I was snorkeling around (I received a camera replacement from Pentax, however). I lost a week of work because I didn't have an underwater camera that worked to collect my data. The second camera they sent me still has the condensation issue...hence leakiness issue.I still bought the WG-1 despite my previous issues; I hoped they had fixed the issue. *Nope*. After I took it in the water for an hour at 2-3 ft depth(I use this camera for underwater pics of marine organisms for work), I noticed the condensation. So I put it back on the boat. Then later the condensation was gone, so back in it went. No problem. However, I also noticed that the condensation appears when the camera is out of the water.  So this leaky issue makes using the camera in the water difficult. For me, having a camera that works flawlessly in the water is essential.Other issues: I am not sure why but the focus (especially when in macro mode) will focus on an object perfectly and then the second I take the pic unfocuses itself. I don't know why it does this but its quite frustrating.Major issue (that I hope Pentax will reply to from my email tech support form): the LED lights just started to turn on when the camera was off. It was a bit odd to have this camera suddenly turn on when its sitting on my desk. So the LEDs are on whenever the battery is in. The lights also remain on when using the camera (even in non-microscope mode, of course). Sometimes the lights flicker and sometimes only 1 light is on. And the camera was not recently in the water so that is not likely a cause of the issue.So I hope that Pentax will honor the one year warranty and replace my camera or refund me, but at the same, I'm wary about getting another of this model. In fact, I just can't recommend it. As great as this camera is when it works, the threat of losing your camera and pics on a once in a lifetime vacation (or for me, precious data!!) doesn't make it worth the risk.Pentax if you are reading this review--- you have an excellent camera IF you can get this waterproofing issue (& other issues) worked out.

Reviews.Title: Beyond Expectations
Reviews.Author: AspenWillow "AspenWillow"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a Grand Canyon raft trip.  It was tested in every way except at depth or below freezing.  I videoed while being slammed head-on in all the big rapids and the camera still kept videoing.  The quality was superb.  I used automatic settings on both video and still shots.  The quality was amazing and I love the menu display.  I can actually make my menu selections without putting on reading glasses.  The icons are easy to see with vibrant color.  I did not have any issues with water leakage.  I dropped it once on hard dirt and no problems.  I also dropped it into deep sand twice and just dunked it in the water to clean it off.  The design and color of the camera are way cool, too.  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Laikaikea
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a honeymoon cruise with my wife.  We took our Pentax WG-1 with us during an excursion on the island of St. Thomas.  The first, and subsequently last, time we took the camera under water it ceased to function within the first 2 minutes. At a depth of 20 ft the screen went black and started taking on water.  I now have an inoperable camera.  Be careful in the water...

Reviews.Title: The Good One ... & ... the Bad One
Reviews.Author: SD
Reviews.Content: *** Update 6-26-12 *** I ordered the WG-II (newer model) and have already taken it underwater.  There are definite improvements to the "Waterproofing" of the camera parts.  It worked well so far but I've learned not to risk losing everything and downloaded the photos immediately!  I am happy with the new purchase!***********************************************************Okay - I've purchased this camera twice.  I originally bought this same camera in July of 2011.  It was stolen out of my car (which had over 100 pictures I had not downloaded yet) and decided to purchase the same camera/same color because it was such a great underwater camera.  I'll get to the new camera review in a minute ...The first camera - it is an awesomely small and easily handle-able  camera - even for my 9 year old.  It is light weight and although a little slow on the shutter speed took great pictures.  Blues and greens had awesome picture quality which is usual for Fuji pics but not many others.  So, although it was slow, this was outweighed by how easy it was to use.  I have to agree that the on/off switch is in a bad place next to the shutter button and sometimes gets turned off instead of taking pictures.  The only other con was the startup time.  It has this little audio chirp and screen shot before it's ready to take pictures.  Again, for an extremely rugged camera that took pictures snow skiing (extremely cold) as well as underwater at amusement parks - its a good camera.The second replacement camera (different vendor from the first purchase) came in the mail and our first excursion this past weekend was to our waterpark.  The camera took great pics but the first immersion into the wave pool fried the camera completely.  If I hadn't had the camera previously - I would have said I did something wrong in inexperience - but this was such a horrible experience having lost some great pictures twice now (granted the first was to a theft). I looked to see if I mistakenly purchased a refurbished camera the second time and found that I did not so I am left to wonder how two of the same cameras could leave such varying experiences. The camera froze and then eventually turned off leaving a fogged screen and loss of pictures.  Having just purchased the camera, I immediately returned this camera and am waiting on the refund so that I can find something else.I've looked all day at other underwater cameras to buy - I need one for my son's birthday party at the same waterpark in a couple weeks.  Nothing else out there is like it - they are bigger, bulkier, and terrible reviews.  I am looking at possibly upgrading to the WG-II but am paralyzed with fear of getting fried again.....

Reviews.Title: Absolutely not waterproof.
Reviews.Author: guadasan
Reviews.Content: I bought this in November 2011. This camera "Pentax Optio WG-1 Adventure Series 14 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom (Black)" claims to be waterproof, but it isn't. Water seeped into the camera when I took it snorkling, the SD Card that was inside can no longer be read, I lost many important photos. And the camera can no longer be used. It was the first and only time I took it underwater. Repairing it is a hassel when I can put my money towards a better camera that is actually waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: firewallbill "firewallbill"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a once in a lifetime Swim with The Manatees vacation.The camera is easy to use, functioned flawlessly, and takes better pictures than I would have thought.I've had Pentax cameras since - gasp - the Spotmatic SLR days, you know, the screw on lenses?Yes, I am that old.I loved the simple ergonomics and optical quality.  Plus they were rugged.Well, this camera must be the Spotmatic of the underwater world.  By no means a Pro camera, but if you need a simple underwater camera that can double as a general purpose vacation, hiking / biking camera this is a great choice.I still have - and used - my Canon G series, but they are fragile compared to this and certainly not waterproof.I ended up tossing the Pentax Optio in my bag, pocket, etc. without issue.  It's earned a permanent spot (pun intended) in my computer bag.Down to 15 feet it was flawless. We were never in water deep enough to challenge it's rated depth, manatees are generally shallow water dwellers.Some flower pictures were gorgeous - it has macro functions.Overall people / scenics were beautiful and will make nice prints.  Exposures and colors are accurate and pleasing.The flash was great at shadow relief.Are there any knocks?  There are a lot of menu functions, but I found most could be ignored.  The underwater setting helped some for color cast.  Focusing underwater seemed slow, but the murkiness of some of the locations may be a culprit.I was worried about battery life, but never ran dry.The view screen always seems to show overexposure or harsh colors but the picture is fine - just use it for composition and let the electronics judge exposure.Overall, it's the perfect knockabout camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: valettac
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with this little camera. It has many of the same features of the much more expensive brands and the panorama stitching is virtually idiot proof. We took it to the Florida Keys to use in wet and sandy areas so that my dslr wouldn't get ruined and it was well worth it, got some amazing underwater shots. My only complaint is that rechargeable battery doesn't last long enough. Fixed that by purchasing two spares and a car charger. The super macro mode is amazing but I would recommend using a tripod to reduce shake. I'm very pleased with this and it makes a very nice second, tag-a-long camera that can be used virtually anywhere. Very compact, light and easy to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio WG-1
Reviews.Author: The Dude
Reviews.Content: Impressive point and shoot. The camera boots in about 1.5 seconds. Great for quick picture if you are caught off guard and need to snap a quick picture. Has a lot of build in picture macros like self portrait. Any time the camera finds a faces it takes a picture. Fun if you have no idea what it is doing. It also has a microscope mode great for the kids to have fun with. Also being drop proof & water proof it makes for a great kid proof camera. Only complaint is underwater picture are hard to take looking thru the back screen as the sun makes it hard to see what is on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for outdoor activities.
Reviews.Author: THobbs
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to follow my grandson on the beach.  We have used it in the ocean, on the beach, and on the boat.  It is great to not have to worry about the sand and water. I recently used the camera to record fireworks. The pictures are amazing.

Reviews.Title: AT Hiker
Reviews.Author: Goldie
Reviews.Content: My son just finished hiking the AT and took over 3,000 pictures with this. He loved everything about it and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I thought.
Reviews.Author: Martin Portelli
Reviews.Content: Had this for about 6 months but was only used maybe 3 or 4 times. Never in water. The reason it wasn't used so much is because the picture quality isn't that great. Actually it's pretty bad once you transfer them to your PC. Very, very grainy even on the highest settings.Used it the first time in water last week...well actually on a kayak and lo and behold....the LCD went a dark black and can't see anything anymore. Pretty bummed out. Would not buy again for sure.

Reviews.Title: It could be good camera... but it's not waterproof
Reviews.Author: DMITRIY LISICHKIN
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for 2 years.I liked everything, except battery life. Very convenient in daly usage outdoors. Did not have any major problems. Just some minor issues as (occasional) autofocus failure, especially in low light condition. Video of average quality, but that was not important for me. The only thing I missed (except larger battery) was view finder for more precise underwater shots.And then, just after 2 years warranty expired, I took it for another swimming-snorkelling trip...Have spent about 1.5 hours total at 3 sites, mostly swimming on surface, occasionally diving to 3-4 m and just once or twice to 5-6 m. All was good, until later on board of a boat I looked through videos and pictures. Video suddenly stopped and camera shut down.Later, in hotel, I opened covers, took out SD card and battery and left it to dry. No success, camera stayed dead.Both covers (connection ports and battery/card compartment) were in perfect order and closed, - I always checked them before to go in water. The camera has never been damaged, dropped or hit, - ever.It happened right in the middle of my holiday trip, with several more diving trips planned. What a disappointment.The camera was inspected by authorised local service. Their conclusion: mainboard should be replaced. But there are none in stock, and can not be ordered.I have discussed repair at Pentax UK. Their reply: if the mainboard is damaged, they will NOT help.What a fantastic technical support, indeeed.So, now I'm left with nice and useless piece of plactic. Thanks to producer's fault.I doubt that I'll buy any Pentax/Ricoh product again, ever.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: steve trinh
Reviews.Content: I use it to take dental intra-oral photos for patients.  Staff loves it because it's light and easy to use.  The quality is a little bit less than the Nikon DSLR D100 with macro lens and ring flash set up I was using before but it's like comparing a Toyota Yaris to a Ferrari.  I'm not implying that the camera is cheap or inadequate.  Quite to the contrary, it is perfect for what I'm using it for.  Unless you're a dentist who takes intraoral photos to publish in a professional journal, the photo quality is adequate to diagnose or to communicate with patients.  You have to adjust the settings to make it work in a dental environment but I have no problem recommending this camera to all my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: spruggie
Reviews.Content: This camera came to me on time, like new. It cuts on in about one second and takes really good photos, it's smaller than I thought it would be and incredibly light. The picture quality isn't perfect meaning I can't zoom in on small text and read it but photos look beautiful. Because the camera is tough I take it everywhere and the battery lasts all day. is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: I really wanted to love this
Reviews.Author: Jaxta
Reviews.Content: Leakage problems...my first one leaked within a couple of weeks. The replacement lasted just over a year...I guess the seal really just isn't that resilient. I swim almost daily and usually take a camera along, so i'm pretty demanding on the seals, so I guess I could forgive this if it actually took good photos.Thing is, it's actually hard to use in the water...the power button is way too close the the capture photo button and they're both too small and hard to press, particularly if it's a little cold in the water and the fingers are a little more clumsy than usual.Also always seemed to have issues with the auto-focus in the water, and took too long to reset for the next shot.It looks great and feels good in the hand (although don't rely on the caribiner to be of any use...aluminium, cheap and flimsy) and seemed to live up to the shockproof claims given that it bounced around in my swim bag for all that time. Replaced with the Nikon (Pentax didn't return my emails since I was out of warranty) and will NEVER look back/ If you insist on it, please get the extended warranty.

Reviews.Title: More Hype than Quality
Reviews.Author: MC
Reviews.Content: We really thought this camera was going to be sooo much better than our old pentax. We purchased because we needed a waterproof camera to take boating. We have a great little older pentax camera that has had no problems except is not very moisture proof because it is not designed to be. Since this older pentax had been so good for us, we wanted to purchase the same brand, just waterproof. This new waterproof Pentax does not even come close to the quality of pictures our cheaper older one does and is not very easily used in quicker situations like our point and click camera. Too many settings but way less quality of pictures. They are more blurry, less clear, less focused and seem to be very poor at night shots, with or without night setting. Our older camera takes excellent night pics. We are very disappointed in this new purchase and are out lots of $$$. The shipment arrived  quickly but this camera sucks. .....wonder if something happened to it or if it was refurb.....?????

Reviews.Title: Very useful All Purpose camera for the family
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I like to be brief, but the camera has well exceeded my expectations and has been the best camera I've ever used.-) Amazing when you're the only person who can take pictures at waterparks, pools, lakes, etc.. without fearing it getting wet-) D-Ring keeps this compact camera on your belt loop and no cumbersome camera bag to keep track of.-) Only camera i could trust my 6 year old to take pictures with-) Used the camera's microscope feature along with a glass mount with a back light to quickly, but manually scan over 5600 slides from my grandfather.  I was able to give the digital copy to all members of his family without shelling out hundreds of dollars for some company to scan lower res imagesI could keep singing the product's praises, but I believe those bullets are the highlights.

Reviews.Title: WG-1 not water proof
Reviews.Author: clay
Reviews.Content: Do not put the WG-1 in water. I owned my WG-1 for 15 months when I decided I wanted to take a few photos in my pool. I was only in the pool about 5 to 10 mins. when the camera flooded. Sent it back to Pentax. Because it was more than 12 month old the warranty was null and void. They actually sent the flooded camera back to me.

Reviews.Title: NOT WORKING, but replaced by manufacturer
Reviews.Author: Mexican lady
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use in the pool to take picture inside the water, but the camera has water inside de viewer and stopped working. I hope they return my money since I paid a lot of money for it. I am not sure how to apply the warranty.Good news, they replaced my camera, very good service from manufacturer. I haven't had time to test my new camera. Hope it works well.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Dot
Reviews.Content: Despite the reviews that said this leaked, I purchased it since I really didn't believe that Pentax would sell a camera that wasn't waterproof. Well that was a huge mistake. I have owned an Olympus waterproof camera for years and it has been great, but it was getting pretty scratched and the battery was dead. I purchased this Pentax to replace the old one for my overseas trip. Before putting it in the water I checked all the seals for any dirt of hair that might cause it to leak. It looked perfectly clean, but after my snorkeling trip it had water in it, the lights on the front were blinking, and it wouldn't take anymore pictures. On the plus side, Amazon refunded my money ASAP. I just didn't have a camera for the second half of my trip. My friend got this exact same camera and it worked great for her on all the same activities. Perhaps it is just luck of the draw on which batch your camera comes from, but I won't be buying another one of these.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Video
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I had the earlier version of the Pentax Optio W90 a few years ago primarily for video on my sailboat.I felt the quality, especially in HD was outstanding. Picture quality was also very good and even though I am not an expert in taking pictures, I was very happy with the Option W90.Sadly, I lost the darn thing and needed a replacement.The next generation was the WG-1 and I thought it would everything I needed. Waterproof (even deeper than the W90!), more rugged and a greater pixel capability.Pictures come out fine for me, once you get used to the delay and how to coax the camera into focusing on far away shots, they look great.Video on the other hand is a complete disappointment. After buying the camera I finally found tons of posts concerning the camera's inability to take even fair videos in sunlight. Every video I takes looks like a bad Super 8 film from the 60's. Colors are washed out, there are lines throughout the videos.This camera was a waste of over $200 and I will be forced to find a suitable replacement for me needs! I just don't understand how a next generation camera would be worse than an older version.I hate to be so negative. I bought on Ebay and I'm stuck with it, not the seller's fault. But for the first time, I am so frustrated with a product and if I thought Pentax would care, I'd send them a letter. Since that's not going to happen, all I can do is tell others.

Reviews.Title: Capturing the Caymans
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: This camera was great. I was slightly concerned based on reading reviews of many other underwater cameras, but this one worked perfectly everyday underwater to capture our pictures. It was a great camera for the price and would recommend it to anyone looking to purchase a camera for vacation or any other occasion. The many different modes were also helpful to capture everything we did. We did clean and dry the camera after every use, so following the manual and directions will definitely add to the longevity and life of the camera. Overall it was a great buy and I would definitely say it is one of the best on the market for both value and quality!

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof and repaired twice
Reviews.Author: Mario A. Ginebra
Reviews.Content: Purchased in December of 2011.  Used it underwater for the first time in April 2012.  The screen began to fill with water immediately. This is not the battery compartment, water was actually behind the screen.  It stopped working within minutes.  Returned the camera to CRIS, Pentsx's repair contractor.  It took 4 weeks to get a replacement.  They did send a brand new camera in the box with a new battery, charger, etc.  Now in June 2011, the new camera has an intermittent problem where it will not turn on with the battery door closed.  Ironically, if I open the battery door, it will come on and work correctly. It's going back to the repair contractor again.  By the way, I own a Pentax WG, the original version of this camera and it still works very well.  I have taken literally thousands of pictures with that camera and gave it to my daughter when I purchased the WG-1. Now I wish I had it back.

Reviews.Title: STAY FAR AWAY!
Reviews.Author: HockeyPaul
Reviews.Content: Hello,On a last minute whim on vacation with my family to a water park, we decided to purchase a waterproof camera.We started to Best Buy, and liked the Olympus tg-820 but didn't like the price.  We found this pentax at target.  The look of the camera is aggressive and fits well in your hand.  The price was right, so we went with it.Took it to schlitterbahn the next day and took a few photos with it while waiting for the first water ride.  Worked fine with the exception of the lens would get droplets on it, and the oils of your fingers made it almost impossible to clean it. (and wet swimming shorts only brought more water droplets)  We decided to hit up the lazy river and that's when I found out said "waterproof camera" was in fact "not so waterproof".Tried to take a underwater photo and instantly saw it had water on the inside.  The lens and the rear screen had condensation in it.  By the time we left the water, it was almost too hot to touch and blinking through various screens.  My biggest fear was that I lost all my photos of the family from the evening before.Good news is we have the photos.  Bad news is the camera is miserable. The seal where the card and battery sits is lose and wiggles (which is the main issue with it).My advice is spend 100 more bucks and get a quality camera.  Looks are very deceiving with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great DURABLE outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera so far.  I normally go through cameras like water, but this one has held up with everything I have done so far.  Very easy to use, a good little point-and-shoot.  So far I have 2 complaints; if they went through all the trouble to make it shock/wet/sand-proof, one would think they would use a tougher screen, one that resists scratches better.  I went climbing with it ONCE and I got a scratch on it.  The second complaint was the day after I went deep-water-soloing with it, the lens was fogged up.  The camera was taking pictures, but they weren't too good.  Open up the battery compartment and it seems to air out after 20 min or so.All and all, it seems a rather sturdy outdoor sports camera

Reviews.Title: Too bad "life-proof" doesn't include shooting one-handed
Reviews.Author: Synergyrl
Reviews.Content: Image quality, controls and features are excellent.  Shutter lag is minimal.  The zoom range is perfect - a 5x medium-wide to medium-telephoto range is much more useful in fast action situations than a 10x normal to long tele.  The camera easily slides in and out of a shirt pocket, and it's rugged.  Most of the moving parts are internal, and that's a big plus: no motorized lens wimpily zooming in and out and getting stuck when it meets its first grain of sand.  I love the idea of a "lifeproof" camera to take along when you're doing something exciting and memorable - in other words, something worth photographing!  My issue is that they don't take the concept far enough.Consider the circumstances when you're kayaking, mountain biking, rock climbing or snowboarding.  Chances are you only have one hand free for photography because the other one is busy fending off disaster (and if you're mountain biking, the free hand should be the left one).  You're probably wearing sunglasses, maybe gloves too, and if you have to set the camera down there may be nothing around but rocks or dirt to set it on.Now look at the WG-1 or its successor, the WG-2.  All the controls are crammed against the right edge of the top and back, so if you're holding the camera in your right hand, it's pretty hard to reach anything with your right thumb except the zoom control.  Many of the controls are too close together to easily work with gloves on, although the critical power, shutter release and zoom controls are a little more spread out.  There's no viewfinder, so you have to either "shotgun" your composition or take off the sunglasses and use the unavailable left hand to shade the LCD screen from harsh sun glare.  (To be fair, it's a pretty bright screen.)  If you set the camera down and it can't balance on its narrow bottom edge you'll scratch either the lens or the LCD screen.So what can you do?  I made a wrist strap the exact length necessary to keep the camera in my palm while my fingers push against it, giving the thumb and forefinger as much room as possible to grope around, but it's not a very stable grip.  I can hold the camera upside down in my left hand and push the shutter release with my thumb, leaving the right hand free to work the rear brake of the mountain bike.  I keep the macro ring always attached, giving the lens a little separation from the dirt if the camera falls over on its face.What could Pentax do differently with the next lifeproof camera?  Most of the drawbacks have to do with that nice big LCD screen, and that's too bad because big screens seem to be as much a selling point as megapixels used to be.  Here's a bold idea: make a smaller screen dedicated to data and image review only, add a nice optical viewfinder, use the extra room on the back to make the controls bigger and located for convenient one handed use (I guess it will have to be the right hand).  Add a little ergonomic bulge on the right edge so it's easier to grip the camera.  Recess the lens and the LCD screen behind a protective rim.  (There are four tiny raised dots that keep the LCD screen from getting scratched if you lay it on a glass table top, but they don't help with a rougher surface.)  If these ideas are too radical, how about a pop-up folding cover plate for the LCD screen that protects it when closed and shades it from the sun when open?  Maybe even a lens cap?  But I really want that viewfinder.The WG-1 is still a great camera overall.  I just think the "lifeproof" label really means childproof or idiot-proof, and it's not really designed for the circumstances implied by the fake-carabiner accessory strap that comes with the camera.

Reviews.Title: One tough camera
Reviews.Author: Dar
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son who likes to snorkel.  He took it on a Tough Mudder run which is an eleven mile run through obstacles such as mud, water, & more mud. He said at one point he had to scrape mud off the lens so he could continue to take pictures and amazingly it still works!  I would highly recommend the Pentax Optio WG-1 camera.

Reviews.Title: I'm so glad I have this!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Ralph
Reviews.Content: This is an all around excellent point and shoot camera, even if you do not plan to take it into harsh situations. It may not be as slim as some other point and shoots, but the waterproofing, durability and diversity of camera modes more than make up for it's moderate size.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio WG-1 Waterproof Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my dad as a birthday present.  He orginally had the Nikon Coolpix.  That's a good camera too but he wanted something with a rechargable battery.  This camera is awesome.  I have the older version and love it also.  My dad too it on a cruise to the Bahamas and got some really great pictures.  With grandkids around I'm sure this camera will get dropped, kerplucked in water, you name it.  The camera is very sturdy, and compact. Love the hook that came with it, my dad just hooks it on his belt loop.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Adventure Camera
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I needed an easy to use camera that can go anywhere and is rough and tough like myself. I was very pleased with the ergonomic shape of the Pentax Optio WG-1.It feels great in my hand and it is so easy to use. The picture quality is fantastic and it is great for catching action shots. This camera is durable and dependable and I would highly recommend it to any adventure lovers who love to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Need to work on the water proofing
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: So everything about this camera is great!!! Love the smile capture, dog face recognition, and all the other little cool quirks it has. However we took the camera on vacation and went snorkeling and the camera got wet. I thought (like everyone else) that the battery cover doesn't seem to fit tight but figured it was good enough. I don't know where or how the water got in but its dead now. I just hope I don't run into any warranty issues...Another small issue I have ran into is that we do allot of hiking in the mountains so we are always around rocks and because this camera doesn't have a lens cover or any way of protecting the lens I was always worried about the lens getting scratch by a rock when I had the camera clipped on my pack. It never got scratched but I could see it happening very easily.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Saurabh lauria
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera. We took it to shoot pictures in Alaska trip in outdoor low light dim conditions. While this is not a expensive Digital SLR With a 20-300 mm lense camera, it worked just fine and the pictures were very reasonable for us. We like it and recommend to anyone who wants to caputre pictures in diffult conditions and expect reasonably good, but neither too great nor bad of a results..

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kgorman
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera so I have not had a ton of time to play around with all of the options, but I have taken hundreds of pictures (both under water and out of water) and I absolutly love the results. The only complaint that I have with this camera is the menu is not very user friendly. I am very good at manuvering around a camera menu and have done so with many different types of cameras, but this one gave me a bit of difficulty.

Reviews.Title: That is a good option
Reviews.Author: leonardo
Reviews.Content: it is easy to take along with me when I travel and field working. There is no need to worry about splashing water or dropping on the floor, It is cool that you can treat your camera just as a tool, like a screwdriver , for your working

Reviews.Title: First one not waterproof but great customer service at Amazon
Reviews.Author: Phillip M. Rhoades
Reviews.Content: I received my order yesterday and read all the literature immediately.  I bought the camera while on a vaction/reunion with my family that I hadn't seen together in 10 years.  Took the camera to the lake with us.  It performed well for a few hours in and out of the water and on a fishing boat.  Unfortunately, the screen and lens fogged up and the "focus assist" light stayed on.  I tried to dry it out over night but it seems to not help.The Good:  Amazon was really helpful and has mailed a replacement with 1-Day service.  Hoping to get it tomorrow and be able to take photos of the family again.  Thanks Amazon and hope the problem was limited to the camera and not the model.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Szekely
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip to Mexico where I was wanting to be able to take pictures/video underwater. I loved the versatility of being able to take pictures and video in/out of water without having to worry about ruining my camera if it got dropped or wet.The quality of the video isn't high as I was expecting for it being HD, but it is quite good and I'm satisfied with it. I was able to film manatees, turtles, rays, and fish no problems or a whole lot of graininess.My friends that went with me were very jealous and were quite frequently "borrowing" it. =)I would recommend it if you are looking for a decent quality underwater camera.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio WG-1
Reviews.Author: Michael 2131
Reviews.Content: I purchased the WG-1 for as my primary underwater and on-land camera for a trip to the Galapagos Islands.  The rugged nature of the design, small size, good zoom, and 14MP resolution were all factors in selecting it.  It performed pretty well in most respects, but the lack of any meaningful image stabilization system truly hampers taking many fine photographs.  I used it on only one occasion underwater and did not have the proper mode selected.  I certainly cannot blame the camera for my error.  The waterproof protection worked perfectly.The limited use convinced me that I need to purchase a good quality DSLR and use the WG-1 as a back-up.

Reviews.Title: Nifty point N shoot
Reviews.Author: Mark H. DORSETT "hoxivuti"
Reviews.Content: This is my third waterproof camera, but my first Pentax.  It has lots of up-to-date technology (HD Video, LEDs up front for macro lighting and other tricks) and produces nice panoramas, stills and videos.  One complaint: For a camera that's designed to follow you to the rugged outdoors in and around water, the exposed front lens seems just too, well, exposed.  (This was never a problem with my Olympus cameras, which cover the lens when the unit is turned off.)  You can address this by fitting the provided pop-off filter ring with a screw-on lens cap, but Pentax doesn't supply one.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality & HORRIBLE WARRANTY/NO REPLACMENT
Reviews.Author: Snakeback
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to upgrade from my Olympus version, mainly becuase it got good reviews & I liked the style more.  I took this on 2 trips within 1 years time.  Otherwise, it sat quietly in its box in my office untouched.  First trip was to Peru to hike the inca trail & it worked okay, but wasnt anything better than the Olympus I thought I was upgrading.  This year I took it to the Galapagos, and it died halfway thru my trip becuase it TOOK ON WATER.  It was 2 weeks outside of the 1 year warranty, and I sent it to Pentax after being told that they would fix or replace it since it was so close to the warranty expiration date.  Pentax called and told me it was unrepairable, and they wouldnt replace it, and basically said  "its not our problem."  Normally I wouldnt care if I got my moneys worth out of my gear, but it died because of water damage while snorkeling, the exact thing it claims to not do. No breaking,cracks or damage from myself. Any company that doesnt stand by a product that ceases to work as a direct cause for what its advertised to do should be avoided.  You have been warned.  Nikon or Sony........you will get my money moving forward. Pentax, you will certainly fail at some point if you dont tighten up

Reviews.Title: Pentax & Water Don't Mix
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: Great outdoors camera for the rain, but mine lasted only one snorkling trip before getting moisture inside and the display died.  I was very careful to make sure the two "watertight" access points were sealed tight before going in the water but it still leaked.  Never got it more than two feet under water and made sure it was dry before I took the card out to transfer the photos.  Not a good choice for underwater use.  Looks cool though.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio W90 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: Regarding this product and this reseller - Priced Great.I was given this camera for a retirement gift in June 2011 with the intention of using it when I visited the Caribbean for underwater snorkelling.  This had been a life time dream of mine - to snorkel the Caribbean when I retire and this was the perfect camera to capture not only great images, but video as well.  I had not even opened the box until November when the month long trip was planned for.  I used the camera in Grand Turks, capturing some amazing images of the hundreds of kinds of coral.  Upon reviewing the images, the camera just stopped working.....2 days into the month long trip and the first of six snorkelling adventures.  It was done!When I arrived home, I email Amazon , who referred me to Priced Great.  They will not honor any warranty - 30 days at that! - and have referred me to Canon.  I am very disappointed with both Amazon and Priced Great.  Sounds like a lot of buck passing to me.  Not going to buy from Amazon again!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: James M. Coleman "Colemanx4"
Reviews.Content: I read most of the reviews before I bought this camera and, I admit, I was a little hesitant to purchase.  But, I needed a camera so I figured I'd try it...Amazon has never let me down before.  I LOVE THIS CAMERA!  I took it to Mexico the week after buying it and it has performed like a champ.  No leaks (we snorkeled with it in salt, fresh, and pool water).  Very rugged and takes great photos.  It has photo settings for just about every situation...I especially enjoyed photographing food and foliage with it (there are settings for both).
