I discovered that the Auto setting seems to shoot better underwater photos than the "Underwater Photo" setting.  Also, the digital zoom gets pretty grainy.  But...for the money...and for the adventurous types...this is a great buy.  Go to my Facebook page and check out my Mexico album for the results[...]

Reviews.Title: Most versatile, tough little camera ever built!
Reviews.Author: sharon hood
Reviews.Content: I hook this camera on my jeans and take it everywhere.  It has settings enough to cover situation and even takes video.  It is waterproof, dustproof, shockproof and kidproof.  LOVE IT!  Light weight and does the job beautifully.  You don't need to be a pro to take great shots with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Macro focus?  !!
Reviews.Author: roaeja "Hey you!"
Reviews.Content: Overall, I like this camera.  BUT, the macro is a bit frustrating.In 1cm macro the image comes in nice and clear, but when you try totake a picture, it gets all blurry!  Why?  So, you have to go toMF (manual Focus) mode to take the shot.  This is with the camera lyingdown flat on a surface.  I think it is because the IR focus light is onthe outside of the macro tripod (?) and not inside.  On manual you geta big in focus image, but the moment you press the capture button to takea picture, it goes back to a smaller image.  Help?  No, I haven't readthe book, it is over three hundred pages LONG!I suggest using the 'digital microscope' in the mode selection menu, thisseems to work for average macro viewing and photos, go to the 'macro'menu on the right of the 4 way toggle button, for more refined shots,but do use the MF mode for really close in shots.  I can't understandwhy the zoom in button at the top, goes out of focus.  It is still a wonderfulcamera, with many attributes and a long learning curve.  Best of luck.Oh, do turn off the led lights if you aren't doing any macro photography,or it will exhaust your battery level, <less than 30 minutes.  Go to thebottom of the menu mode to uncheck it.

Reviews.Title: NOT SHOCK PROOF
Reviews.Author: Gunter I. M. Oliveira
Reviews.Content: The CAMERA BROKE IN THE FIRST USE. ITS NOT SHOCK PROOF. VERY BAD. The LCD BROKE ON THE FIRST DAY THAT USED A CAMERA. WAS ALL WHITE. I HAD TO SEND FOR REPAIR. BUT AT LEAST THE PENTAX GAVE ME THE WARRANTY

Reviews.Title: Broke after 2 days
Reviews.Author: sierraman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take on a 9 day cruise to the Carribean.  The first time I removed the battery for recharging one of the battery contacts broke off and fell out of the camera.  Needless to say, the camera was kaput for the rest of the trip.  Don't know if I just got a lemon or if this is a manufacturing flaw affecting all Pentax WG-1 cameras.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Broke within 3 weeks.
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to its claim to be a camera of adventure. I owned the camera three weeks and used it a few times, but never under any stressful conditions.  Then I took it with me to Guatemala. The LCD screen broke in my carry on luggage.  The luggage was never pressed very harshly, but the item broke.  My Kindle and Kindle Fire were both also in the luggage but did not break.  Unfortunately, this happened on my way to Guatemala.  So I get here with no camera. And since I will be here for the next six months, I really can't return the item and I am out $250 bucks. To say that I am disappointed is an understatement.  This camera is total garbage.  Do not buy it.  Take my advice.  I read the reviews and figured that the negative reviews were just a normal minority of buyers, but in this case I do not agree with that assessment.  This is not a rugged camera.  It may have rugged features, but it has several weak links, of which the LCD screen is a major one. This camera is simply not what it is advertised to be and is not nearly as rugged as advertised.  Do not be suckered into buying it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: BobCat
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I can take it anywhere, in around and under water.  It always works and takes great pictures.  there is a bunch of different easy to use modes to take all types of pictures.  ;I really like the macro mode, who'd of thought that I would be taking pictures of bugs.

Reviews.Title: Photo Adventure
Reviews.Author: pat
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take to Maui.  It was to be used primarily for skin diving. The camera's shutter speed underwater was delayed which caused the pictures to be out of focus.  For the price I paid for this camera I could have purchased a waterproof case for my old Canon Rebel.  The on/off switch is difficult to work as it is very small. You need to firmly hit it just right with your nail to engage the switch.The camera for ordinary shots out of the water is very clear. It is what you should expect from a standard point and shoot camera.  I would still be concerned with the shutter speed if you are attempting an action shot.

Reviews.Title: This is the best pocket camera I have found.
Reviews.Author: Tony Guarino
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything and more. I have taken it to the keys and taken pictures and videos underwater. I use it more for work, because I don't have to worry about it getting wet.

Reviews.Title: Little but strong!
Reviews.Author: bianca fulkerson
Reviews.Content: I take this camera everywhere! Cave swimming and snorkeling, rappeling, hiking etc... Dropped many times..It is a strong camera, worth of the price. Make very good images in the water and also videos :)

Reviews.Title: Proven Performer
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera coming onto 2 years.  The advantage over my LG phone?  Waterproof!This camera shoots very good pictures, has a great selection of popular settings and the movie quality is good.  The doors to the USB and battery/card are cleverly design and easy to use.  The battery life is also very adequate.  I particularly liked the WG-1 versus the -2 or -3 for its low ISO setting capability.The camera feels good to the hand and not heavy or overly light.  The flash works well.I have used this camera underwater, but it is also useful to bring out on a rainy/misty day without any worry.  Just remember to keep droplets off the lens.

Reviews.Title: A turd sandwhich with Diarrhea jelly!
Reviews.Author: laura bishop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this before going on vacation. Never dropped it or mistreated it. Battery door doesn't seal. Water gets into the camera. DO NOT BUY! The company also sucks when trying to deal with customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for out doors!!
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Great little camera when i don't want to carry a bulky SLR.  This takes some very impressive photos with wonderful color saturation.  Have had it in the water, in the snow, on the slopes, on the beach, fresh water, salt water.  It's great.  Lightweight and easy to manipulate.  No,  it does not do the job of an SLR, but I would  not go kayaking without it!!! Love the stepping ring... i purchased a polarizer to fit it.  Now we've got some nice shots.

Reviews.Title: great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Visnadi
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a vacation a few years ago.  It has paid itself off many times over.  This camera does not take good pictures in poorly lighted areas.  This could be due to use error.  After two years of use the video has light streaking through it,  but that has not damaged the memories.  I'm not sure I expect it to last much longer.  It's had been a terrific underwater camera and has been very reliable.

Reviews.Title: Compartments open underwater
Reviews.Author: PurchaseOptimizer "Purch135"
Reviews.Content: The compartment seals are not too tight and the locks to keep them closed insufficient.  On my first use on a reef snorkel dive, the batter case came open and it died.  Back to the factory for warranty repair, after searching forever on the Pentax site to find out how to do that.  I would not buy again.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: BicyclingVegan
Reviews.Content: We've taken this camera everywhere! It takes great underwater pictures, even in a dirty pond. We've taken pics in fish tanks, pools, oceans, ponds and in the rain. (I wish we had seen the groupon to purchase this camera at half the price.. but oh well! We already bought it.. and we love it).

Reviews.Title: WAV recording sporadic
Reviews.Author: arthur w. yates
Reviews.Content: Not terribly reliable.  I've had five.  Audio WAV file creation not reliable.  Depending on the battery I use, the recording will quit after just a few seconds with no input from me.  On other occasions, it performs well.  The ability to record lengthy WAV files is a critical feature of this camera.  I wish it were more reliable.

Reviews.Title: So Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Courtney L Lancaster
Reviews.Content: This camera gets the job done.  We've taken this camera snorkeling, backpacking, snow caving, skiing, white water rafting, etc.  No issues.  Takes great photos.  Waterproof like it says.

Reviews.Title: Not 33ft, more like 3.3ft
Reviews.Author: Ahoydave
Reviews.Content: The camera worked great until I went down about 10 feet. I immediately dried and opened it up, removed the battery and placed it in a warm place to dry out for days.Water had penetrated the battery cover and the interface cover but I suspect the real damage came from water penetrating somewhere around the buttons. That means there were at least three entry points in what is supposed to be a camera capable of 33 feet.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Gearhead Girl
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few years.  We use it in the pool and snorkling.  The pictures were okay underwater, not great.  Camera worked fine until this last trip.  I brought it home and noticed water around the screen.  I opened the battery door...which was for all appearances secure and found the battery and the SD card wet and ruined.  I looked for the cause of the water...can't find one.  The battery door seems snug and snaps shut.  It just failed.  The camera was ruined as well.

Reviews.Title: Robbery
Reviews.Author: Isaac Finger
Reviews.Content: The first time I use the camera in the beach, in my supposely waterproof camera, water got inside and the camera stop functioning. How Pentax can trick us selling this trash!!! I want my money back.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money and time..
Reviews.Author: MBJL
Reviews.Content: This camera did well for the first 3 months of so...  Got great outdoor shots and was our fishing trip companion...  A year of being in his EDC bag and a trip to Hershey park this past week it decided to fail.  It was fine for the first 20 or so pictures (5 were under water in the wave pool). Then came the fog and water droplets.  We took it out of the water and opened the battery cover and water spilled out..  2 days of drying and even a day in rice and still no good...  Purchasing the WG3 for this fathers-day and hoping it fairs better..  May have to get pentax on the phone to see about an extended warranty this time..  Just save your money and stay way from the WG1!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: A solid Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Barr
Reviews.Content: Where I wasn't very Impressed with pictures aboveground , it certainly made up for it, for the underwater shots ; which is really why I bought it in the first place . If you want a Underwater Camera , then this is it !! Having said that , for other uses , I would look at other choices.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof Camera Wasn't Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey Grant
Reviews.Content: This waterproof camera drown the first time it got near water. Pentax replaced it with a WG-2 which is a great improvement. The photo quality of the WG-2 is fair. Some of the shooting modes are interesting.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoors
Reviews.Author: DCK
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to use outdoors, not really for underwater.  I take it when we go in the woods, four wheeling.  I have not had any problems.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Terry Campbell
Reviews.Content: The camera is exactly what I wanted and does everything as advertised, takes great pictures.  The item arrived quicker that advertised.

Reviews.Title: Problems with battery compartment
Reviews.Author: J. Bailey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last year for my summer trips which commonly includes water.  This camera worked great for the first summer, but I was weary about the waterproof aspect of it.  While on a kayaking trip, it had frequent water contact, left the display screen with lines across it, after it dried out it worked fine.  The main issue I had was this last summer (year 2), I couldn't get it to turn on with fully charged batteries.  My son looked at it for me and found that the battery door was loose and contact was not being met with the battery, so after jamming a piece of something in there to take up the loose space it works, but now I am worried about how waterproof it is.  I would advise if your going to purchase this product, do so at a store where it can be easily exchanged.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful pictures!
Reviews.Author: Mindy Williams
Reviews.Content: This product takes great pictures. Took it to Mexico for snorkeling and it works great!  Very easy to use and it also works great to take my pictures of my grand kids.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: y young
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to go to Hawaii as we knew we would be doing a lot of snorkeling. Love the picture quality. Now it goes everywhere in our backpack with no worries of damaging it.Only thing I don't like is it does not have a lens cover.

Reviews.Title: well worth it
Reviews.Author: andres
Reviews.Content: well worth the money took grate pics  did not use it will diving only snorkeling . it more then paid for it self withe the quality off the pics in the water, and the video was the best . my friends could not believe I used it in the water and these were the pics from it . the one thing is my dive master sad he would not take it more then 20 feet deep . but he sad it was my call my dives were 50 feet so I left it on the boat !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: I have an olympus waterproof camera which seemed to have slowly lost its clarity in taking photographs. When I took it in to have it cleaned, I was told there was no guaranty that it would remain waterproof once cleaned. Since that was the purpose of the camera I decided that I needed to obtain something new and decided to get something besides an Olympus. This camera has worked extremely well. Beautiful clear pictures with good underwater color. I use it primarily for snorkeling, but also use it when taking pictures in the rain in which it does a great job also.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am a VERY clumsy person and broke my last camera by falling on it while hiking. This one has held up very well for me.The underwater pictures are awesome and a lot of fun to take.I camp a lot and love the fact that this can go anywhere with me, including on the boat, and I have no worries as to destroying it. It is a life saver.

Reviews.Title: Outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: Lee J. Calarie "Lee"
Reviews.Content: I've had many Pentax cameras over the years and for theist part they make fine cameras, this  WG-1 being no exception. Eventhough not the latest generation of this model, it has all the features of later models. Compact with a suitable screen. May be a bit small which makes the control buttons a little small and not well located. Seems to take great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing image quality
Reviews.Author: Tony Do
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace my Canon Powershot SD1200 which I loved but after much abuse ended up with the common lens error.  I loved the idea of the Optio WG-1, rugged and tough for outdoor activities.  Unfortunately after taking some pictures with it I found the picture quality to be quite poor compared to my older Canon.  The pictures looked grainy and noisy even at the highest quality setting.  After reading some more reviews this seems like a common complaint.I'll stick with the Canon even though the lens sticks every once in a while.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: Enoch
Reviews.Content: The camera is better than I hoped. We are having lots of fun with it, and with accident prone people, it survives us all.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio WG-1 Advenure Series 14MP Waterproof Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Casey from Florida
Reviews.Content: This camera is a lot of fun!  Shooting macro images with the series of LED lights around the lens is awesome!For the novice user, set up is simple and straightforward, lots of options -- small enough to take anywhere!

Reviews.Title: kidproof too!
Reviews.Author: dori
Reviews.Content: I was a professional portrait photographer and travel alot, so I always have a camera. I have had other digitals and still have 2 SLR's. Unfortunately, I'm a bit of a clutz and have broken more than one camera by dropping or taking to the beach, river or ski slopes. My priority was having a decent snapshot camera for travel and hiking that I wouldn't have to worry about breaking. I haven't tried underwater yet, but did use at the beach and took along rafting on the Delaware. I have also given it to several toddlers to play with (they even managed some pretty decent shots!) and after being dropped, stepped on and thrown at a sibling it it still working great. I have to admit that I only recently downloaded the pix into my laptop-I haven't had prints made yet but the photos looked pretty good. I'm still playing with the settings, but so far am pleased with what I've seen.

Reviews.Title: underwater time-lapse camera
Reviews.Author: flycaster
Reviews.Content: I have three generations of Pentax Optio cameras, the W-30, W-90 and WG-1. The W-30 was initially for snorkeling, it has performed flawlessly for over five years with multiple hours in warm and cold, fresh and salt water with an occasional blurry shot or jerky video that was my fault and easy to correct. I needed a time-lapse camera for doing research with marine snails and the Optios can accomplish that with the Interval Shooting mode. Thus I purchased the newer models as I have needed more cameras in the lab. With computer software we can make movies of our snails movements over many days in aquaria. The cameras have worked nearly perfectly with an occasional dark screen in over 12,000 stills. We just take care to keep the electronics and battery doors clean and rub a barely perceptible coat of petrolatum on the rubber seals to keep them pliable. I looked at a number of other underwater cameras and was unable so far to find one either physically or by internet description with time-lapse and the macro feature.  I am going to set the WG-1 up out in a bay and let it shoot during  a few tide exchanges.  I am sure this was not the manufacturer's intent but I will report here how it survives.

Reviews.Title: fun camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew Martin
Reviews.Content: Great camera for daytime and bright light and truly is waterproof and shock/drop proof.  Only complaint is that it does not take great pictures at night.

Reviews.Title: Hard to please son likes it
Reviews.Author: Charles M Maurer
Reviews.Content: Son likes it because it is waterproof, is rugged, and can fasten toa belt easily. The downsize is that lenses cannot be changed.

Reviews.Title: Pentax WG-1
Reviews.Author: Martin Bascialla
Reviews.Content: Positivo:Facil de manejar, con programas amigables.Buena capacidad de memoria.Negativo:Con baja cantidad de luz, es muy pobre la calidad de imagen.

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Gringo Juan
Reviews.Content: This My first review ever for anything. I am NOT happy with this Camera and with Pentax . I've owned 4 different pentax waterproof cameras over the years starting with a 5 mega pixel optico ,w10,w60 and a wg-1,  1 was stolen but all the others died from the same problem  a cracked crystle, , the w-60 lasted a few years of continued daily use but the latest one WG-1 cracked in only 3 weeks of light use , after talking with Beach Camera they thought it should be covered with the 45 day warannty and shipped it on to Pentax , only to have it returned back  to Me from pentax,  no note or reason. On each of these cameras the price has generally come down and features have gone up  , I'm not sure about the quality going up, Now I have a Panasonic lumix I hope it lasts longer, It should with better reviews , cheaper price smaller size a double locking waterproof door, I wish that somebody wold make a flip phone type crystle protecter, I think that would do more good than rubber corners

Reviews.Title: Maybe I got a bad one.
Reviews.Author: imac7

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: froggybottom79
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased to use at an 8yr olds water park birthday party and it performed amazingly. I was very pleased with the quality and the durability. I would suggest this camera to anyone who wants a rugged and sturdy camera.

Reviews.Title: Works well in shaded pool
Reviews.Author: wahoochick
Reviews.Content: The Pentax Optio WG-1 exceeded my expectations when using it to capture some pics of my boys swimming at the gym's pool.  We were in the shade and even then the images came out nicely.  I reduced the photo file size from 14 MP down to 5 MP or similar just for archival purposes.  Both the pics and videos came out great.  Although I thought the macro feature was just a gimmick, it actually works perfectly when I tested it on some paper documents just for fun.  Pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Non Waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy L. Sutter ""What the hell is an A...
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera from Target as my wife and I are going on a cruise. We decided to test its waterproof ability by taking it in a 6 foot deep pool. We noticed an orange light lit up on the front while in the water. The longer we had it in the water the brighter the light got. The lens started to fog on the inside and the pictures got blurry. When we got out of the pool we dried off the camera and opened the battery compartment and the insides were wet. Needless to say we took it back and got a refund with no questions asked. I enjoyed the camera before the underwater adventure. This should really be a "Splash proof" camera and not waterproof. Now we hunt for a better one before the cruise.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, great pics
Reviews.Author: cruisingfool
Reviews.Content: I decided I was tired of having nothing to showoff after my snorkeling adventures so I purchased this camera to use on my cruise last weekend. It had some of the best ratings from consumer reports and overall positive reviews here on amazon. I was very pleased with the pictures from this camera underwater. I did however have a hard time finding the right setting for photos in low light situations. The battery lasted longer than I expected, probably only through about 200 pics but I had the camera on for hours at a time while snorkeling to be ready to catch anything exciting. I wish I could share some of the pics I took with it on here, they really turned out well.

Reviews.Title: Performed really well, before a surprising failure.
Reviews.Author: Kevin "Williams" Parisi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 10 months ago and it initially lived up to expectations.  The video was so-so, same with picture quality. But I didn't buy this to do pro quality shoots.  I got it because I spend a lot of time outdoors in conditions not suited for an SLR.To that end I have this to say:  The carabiner clip is quite handy for the uber-active types who don't want to wear a fanny pack and when reaching into a pocket is difficult/impossible (ie rock climbing, bicycling, kayaking); just clip it to a belt loop, life vest, backpack shoulder strap, etc.  Also, I've taken it into and underwater numerous times, dropped it, put it in a bag with pounds of equipment sitting on it, taken it into below freezing temperatures.  Basically, I've tested all major features that set a "life-proof" camera apart from a normal point and shoot.  I jokingly called it my Kevin-Proof camera.Kevin-Proof it is not, however.  The thing that ultimately ruined the camera was no where near the advertised limits of its crush-proofness.  I had it in a pocket of my shorts that was near my knee and after having sat cross-legged, or Indian style, for a mere 15 minutes I took it out to discover the screen was smashed.  The advertised weight limit is 100 kg, which is right around my body weight, but sitting the way I was would have only put a small fraction of that onto the camera.  Small enough that I didn't notice I was resting my leg on it.  It is now just short of completely unusable.  I can't change functions (other than back and forth from picture to video because I fortunately made that my option for the programmable green button), but even then I have to put the camera to my ear and listen to weather it "clicks" like the shutter opened and closed or if it beeps like a video is being taken.  Al so underwater shooting is out of the question, as is the macro function, which were my 2 favorite aspects of the camera.I'm out of the country on an extended trip (including hours of scuba and snorkeling) so trying to deal with the warranty is out of the question and buying a new camera is not in the budget. I will however be in Pentaxland (read: Vietnam) in a couple of weeks, so maybe I can pick up cheap parts someone smuggled out of the factory.  ;-)  But probably not.  Guess it's all SLR and caution from here.  I'll try and look at the bright side and think that having delicate equipment in my bag may prevent me from hurting myself.Check out the Olympus Tough series.  I know I will next time I'm in the market.

Reviews.Title: Bad out of the box.
Reviews.Author: Charles M. Douvier "Chas"
Reviews.Content: Full Disclosure: I bought this at Target in the store. It was NOT the display nor was it a return/discontinued model.We bought this home. I charged the batter in a charger that looks very similar to my Sony Cybershot charger.I put in the battery and turned on the camera. For a brief moment the date/time entry came up then the screen went white and froze. I pulled the battery and re-inserted it. The self-focus/timer lamp turns on any time the battery is in the camera but the camera will not longer turn on.I hope you have better luck with yours. I noticed the tech support for this company kind of sucks so I am lucky to be able to take it back to Target tomorrow. Also the WG-1 is discontinued in Japan for the WG-2.. I'd do yourself a favor and skip on this model. Also the GPS would be nice to trim down the weight but we didn't know of or have that option in Target.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it.
Reviews.Author: Scruffytoad "scruffytoad"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before going on a hiking trip.  When it arrived I noticed the door covering the battery and memory card would not stay closed.  Not a big issue, just negates the waterproof aspect.  The camera should be unaffected.The camera took three pictures during the trip.  Very nice pictures, but only three. Then the battery died. I could not recharge it, since I was hiking, and ended up taking most of my trip pictures with a cell phone I didn't plan on using.Took the camera on one other trip.  This time, the screen shattered during transport. I had checked it with my luggage, wrapped up in a sock inside of a steel toed boot. Not the best way to ship electronics, I admit, but you would expect more from something claiming to be shockresistant.The point:  If you want some thing water resistant, this isn't it. If you want something shock resistant, this isn't it.  If you want to spend a lot of money to take three very nice pictures before the battery dies and the camera breaks, this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Opie
Reviews.Content: I got this one partly for a teenager and partly for me to use places I don't want to bring my DSLR. I have been impressed with the picture quality and the macro abilities are amazing.  It went to the beach recently and took some amazing photos in and out of the water.  I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: They call this a camera?
Reviews.Author: NCWingnut
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed in this "camera".  It has held up well as a water resistant battery holder.  The quality of pictures is at best disappointing.  I just reviewed another batch of pictures from an event yesterday.  In one setting, I took pictures with both the WG-1 and a friends android phone.  I could not believe that the phone picture was crystal clear.  The WG-1 picture was so out of focus (both shots) that you could not even tell how many people were in the shot.If you are looking for something that is electronic and waterproof, spend your money on this.  If you are actually looking for someting that can take a picture, go elsewhere, this thing is junk.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Wilcox
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for a trip to the Caribbean. We used it for land pictures, snorkeling and on an underwater excursion 28 feet down. This camera took amazing photos and videos. We did not have any issues. We did follow care instructions. Rinsed after submerging and waited at least 2 hours before we opened battery compartment.

Reviews.Title: GREAT POINT AND SHOOT
Reviews.Author: esj
Reviews.Content: IM AMAZED OF THIS CAMERA, I'VE OWN CANON T3I TOO BUT THIS ONE IS A MUST ESPECIALLY WHEN YOU ARE IN A RUGGED TERRAIN. IT TAKES GREAT PICTURES EVEN IN LOW LIGHT , VERY HANDY AND IM ALWAYS CARRY THIS WHERE EVER I GO

Reviews.Title: Good camera, questionable waterproof ability
Reviews.Author: NAC
Reviews.Content: Camera is very easy to operate with pre-settings adjusted for any scenario. Waterproof function has not been mastered. The battery door is loose and underwater display has glitches yet the picture is fine.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Richard Buchborn
Reviews.Content: Took camera on a Cruise all photos including underwater were excellent. Easy to carry with caribener and point and shoot made things simple.No problems and clarity was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio WG-1 Adventure Series 14 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: R. Alferos
Reviews.Content: The battery door is only closed by a single latch. I bought a refurb model which didn't latch properly and needed to return it. The door that houses the charging port and video out port is much better. Not sure why the battery door is so weak. Disappointing. Outside of that, performance was good. Because of the door, I returned it and plan to buy the Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video (Blue) because the locking mechanism is more secure. The one star is justified because of its lack of adventure proofing. This is not the camera I needed.

Reviews.Title: Leaked in 5 feet of water
Reviews.Author: Ctcs
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this product.  Took it into the swimming pool and used it in the shallow end to film my daughter. Within 10 minutes, the screen went black.  I turned off the camera and set it aside to dry. I opened up the battery door and it was all wet inside. Now the screen is all snowy and 2 of the lights around the lens stays on. Do not buy this camera if you are going to use it in the water unless Pentax decides to redesign the flimsy battery cover.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: Dan Gray
Reviews.Content: With so many inexpensive digital cameras on the market, I had the opinion that if I got a year or two of use, I'd be happy and get the next model with updated features.  I was buying $100 cameras, but our field staff would manage to drop them, bump the display when it's cold (instantly cracking it), or the motor that zooms would get debris in the gears and grind to a halt.So I've change my ways.  I've started investing a little more (around $200) and it's paid off.  The field staff love the camera's wide display, quick startup, and durability.  It's got a nice feature to remember your settings, so you can remove the face detect and flash off for example.I haven't found the need yet for the GPS version, but I'll probably try on later this year.

Reviews.Title: i just testing and works pretty good
Reviews.Author: kmilomed
Reviews.Content: i just using it testing etc, the camera looks pretty cool i already  use it under water in pools and natural rivers in colombia (jardin antioquia) i recommend it

Reviews.Title: Great Adventure Camera Choice
Reviews.Author: Mad Wheelz
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera once and had it stolen but I loved it so much I bought another one. It is every bit as durable as it says it is. Takes amazing quality pictures without being difficult to work. Love the camera

Reviews.Title: Great Features!  Everday photo quality mediocre.
Reviews.Author: Adam D. "Aragon"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for all of the features it had, from being waterproof to having macro capability, to being shockproof.  I'm an outdoor enthusiast, and find that some of the best photos I can get are during the worst weather conditions.  Animals often can't hear or smell you when it's raining for example. Well, to make a long story short: what this camera does well, it does great, but it has shortcomings.  I live in the Northeast and have used it in every weather condition.  On a rainy day you can haul out this camera and get right to work with no worries.  But on a sunny day, this is not the camera to use.Pros:-Waterproof, shockproof, freezeproof.-Clips onto garments/packs.  Have been able to keep this clipped to pack strap/clothing/gear and don't worry about banging it on stuff.-MACRO: this feature, if you figure out how to use it, is Amazing.  Almost worth the money just for this.  (Can be used in move mode too.)-L.E.D.'s on Front.  These work great with the macro feature, but they also count down when using the self timer so you know when the camera is going to fire.Cons:Image quality.  In normal conditions, the photos are somewhat dull and colorless.  It must be because the lens is buried behind the waterproof shell.-Somewhat slow.  It takes a while to write images to disk.To put this poor image quality into perspective, however, let me add that if you need a camera for your pack or boat, or whatever other nook or cranny that is located within a maelstrom of varying weather conditions, when you haul your Optio out on a rainy day, the colors are going to be muted anyway, and there is also going to be a bit of a grainy look about everything anyway.  For example, I had this camera on me when I was hiking in the rain one day and came across a beaver that was chewing on trees.  I was able to get some great video of the beaver in a downpour and it looked very good.  On the other hand, when I try to use it in dry bright conditions, I can't say it's focusing all that well.  The colors are dull.So you are buying a waterproof camera.  Just something to keep in mind.  This may not replace an average point and shoot for the day to day, but it could be indispensable to a hiker, biker, kayaker or boater's equipment.  After 8 months of frustration however, I chose to borrow a Canon SD 1400 and have been using that and have been leaving the Pentax at home; but I'm about to receive a Canon T3i in the mail, and will now have both the Pentax and the Canon DSLR on me from now on.  So in that sense, I love my Pentax because it can take photos that another camera can't.  I can run, hike, and explore with the Pentax while leaving the DSLR in a safe place when necessary.  I also think the MACRO setting will outdo the Canon's abilities until I can afford a lens that will probably cost as much as the entire Optio Camera.  I started writing this review by giving the Optio WG-1 3 stars, but after working on this meandering disaster, I'm bumping it up to 4.I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Good for water activities & macros
Reviews.Author: SMULawyer
Reviews.Content: I'm updating my review 6 months later (July 2012).  I just got back from Costa Rica, and I have to say that BUT FOR this camera, we'd have NO pictures of 90% of the stuff we did in Costa Rica!  From rappelling through waterfalls to white water rafting to surfing to ATVing in the pouring rain through mud and waterfalls.  None of us could risk our very expensive DSLRs for any of these activities, so I was the ONLY one who was able to capture all of this fun stuff!  And this camera takes video, too, so I have great video and pics (not SO great of quality pics, as per my below Dec 2011 review) of everything we did when no one else does!  And I tried out the actually "underwater" pics, and they are awesome--oddly, actually so much brighter/better than many of the other non-underwater pics! Very durable camera and I love the sturdy carabiner (clasp thing), which allowed it to be hooked onto my harnesses, life vests, bathing suits, etc., so it held up and continued taking pics/videos despite being clacked and clanged and banged and smooshed, etc.  Great buy!(Dec 2011) So I'm a camera freak with unreachably high expectations for the quality of my photos. But I was going to Iguazu Falls in Argentina and needed a waterproof camera for the under-the-falls portion of my trip. I researched a lot, and the reviews said this Pentax was durable, took decent pics and took great (very sharp) macros.  All true for the most part.  I'm back from my trip to the Falls, and my pictures are hilarious.  Of course, I'd have MORE hilarious pictures IF I would have switched the camera mode to "underwater."  My understanding of "underwater" was being submerged...not so. If you're taking ANY pictures where water is SPLASHED up at the camera, please change the mode to "underwater," or you will be disappointed like I was.  Once I saw that my pics had huge blurred spots from water drops, I quickly changed the mode to "underwater," and the remainder of my pics are great!  As for non-water activity pics--this camera is decent (not great) enough for outside pics (natural sunlight) but not good enough for my unreasonably high expectations.  Overall good purchase for my purposes, which was to have fun pics of our trip under and through some of the most magnificent waterfalls in the world!  Of course, for all of the non-wet portions of my Falls trip, I used my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: jack of all trades
Reviews.Author: fried banana
Reviews.Content: I tend to be rough on cameras or at least demand more than I should from them.  This is one camera I don't need to worry about.  it takes fantastic pictures and is easy to use if you are the point and shoot type.  However, if you feel so inclined you can dive into the 300+ page owners manual to really get the most out if it.

Reviews.Title: Nice for Underwater Pics
Reviews.Author: Boiler98
Reviews.Content: Took this to the Florida Keys and went snorkeling with it.  Very intuitive to use, and the pics and videos came out well.  Easy to rinse it off.  Very reliable, no leaks.  The included strap is fine, but if you are taking it in the water, be sure to buy a floating strap.

Reviews.Title: underwater camera
Reviews.Author: chase
Reviews.Content: The camera is great and I would highly recommend letting everyone know about the camera to use for underwater photo's for shallow diving.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Casto
Reviews.Content: This camera works great. I like the digital Microscope. The microscope works very good but you have to hold the camera very still or use a small tripod. The battery life could be better. I work in a very tough field and this camera has held up.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Review
Reviews.Author: Albee5150
Reviews.Content: Everything about the camera is appealing, but we took it out to the beach and noticed some moisture buildup on the inside of the screen. It looks like the heat made whatever water moisten the LCD screen cover.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Anyone looking for a solid, durable camera for both outdoors and water related adventures, this camera is perfect.  I did a lot of reviews before I decided on this one.  It was between this and the Olympus, but I decided the look of the Pentax just looked rugged.  Once we got it, it immediately went to the mountains with us.  Used it in the pool, hot tub, hiking, and climbing.  I carried it the whole time in a side pocket of my shorts and its small enough not to be bulky, and really quick and easy to use.  I absolutely love this camera.  Picture quality is really good.  I've been experimenting with the panoramic shots and like those as well.  I highly recommend this camera for any outdoors person.  Can't wait to take it to the ocean and then skiing this winter.  Battery life is excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera--both above and underwater
Reviews.Author: R. Mayer
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 6 weeks.  I just got back from a bicycle tour of the Tuscany region of Italy where I used a 16 GB SD card with it.  I needed a fairly rugged camera that I could carry in the back pocked of my cycling jersey, but didn't want salty sweat to mess up the camera.  It is small and thin so it fit perfectly.  I removed the outer macro focusing ring since I needed the camera a thin as practical.  I shot over 800 pictures and videos with the camera set at the highest resolution and it still said I had about 800 to go on the 16 GB card...amazing. (It actually said I had around 3,800 shots available, if I remember correctly, but the video takes up a good bit of that capacity.  When I got home and downloaded the pictures and videos, there were around 800 that I had shot, not 3,000--thank goodness!)I shot some pictures underwater in a pool and in the Mediterranean at Talamone. I never got deeper than 5 feet, but the shots were excellent. The movies in good light were great, but in low light, they were pretty grainy.  The audio pick-up was great.  Later I will have some of the movies posted on YouTube, searchable using "rhm italy" but it may be a few weeks before I get those on there.  Meanwhile, if you'd like to see some examples of the picture quality of the still shots, go to Flickr at:[ ... ]  and take a look.  Or just go to Flickr and put in a search for "rhm vbt" (w/o the quotations) and you'll see them.  You be the judge on quality. Click on the actual pictures to get all sizes available.Amazingly, the camera also let me shoot in HDR (High Dynamic Range).  See a few examples in Flickr at:[ ... ]  Each of those shots were handheld HDR shots consisting of 3 shots each (+/- 1 f:stop), using the "burst shooting" and "auto bracketing" features at the same time. I don't recommend that w/o a tripod, though.I am SO GLAD I got this camera.  I normally shoot with a Canon DSLR, but that was just too large to take on a  bicycle tour of Tuscany. This camera is great!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera in and out of water.
Reviews.Author: Lubbbr
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera for snorkeling and I was very pleased with the results. I wish it had a more powerful zoom but I was very pleased with both the video and camera for ease of use an quality of the pictures. But what surprised me the most was it's macro feature. Combine this with the chums waterproof camera float(wristlet) and you will have many hours of great fun in the water.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: carrye lou kearns
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use.  Rarely  have to check the manual to see how to do something.  And, mostly importantly, I capture great photos...even the fireworks came out nicely.

Reviews.Title: pentax waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: john57g
Reviews.Content: The Pentax waterproof camera is a good asset for any sportsman or outdoor enthusiasts on a budget and looking for something below $300 and at this price it preformed well although not great in any area. I would recommend this camera for kayak,fishing,snorkeling and diving it takes good pictures above and below the water. The video is a area that Pentax needs to inprove upon and in my opinion the video is very bad at best (THAT'S BEING NICE) I wouldn't recommend this camera unless you only plan to use it as a camera (my first Pentax and the replacement suffer from a bad flare when exposed to normal light and its grainy even in good lighting)I like the durable build and 33ft waterproofing,crush proof,freeze proof  and the cool design it takes good pictures and has some good options as far as settingsThe bad... The video is very bad and in my opinion makes it not worth the price. Changing camera setting is difficult as well and will take some getting used toOverall I would not recommend this camera just due to the video being so bad. So unless you plan to use this solely as a camera I wouldn't buy it..

Reviews.Title: I loveeeeee it :)
Reviews.Author: janesss
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for me.I have tested it once underwater and the pictures were so cool.I love how you can add borders and change what your picture looks like right on the camera.the face detection is perfect for me.Being a teen i still drop stuff and step on thing and i don't have to worry with this camera.I think it was worth the money.So far its a great camera and you should definatelly try it out.

Reviews.Title: Horrible, horrible, horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: This is truly the worst camera I have ever had.  It pains me to even have to give it one star.  I have had over 20 digital cameras in all shapes and sizes and from all makes and manufacturers so I have a very good frame of reference to compare it to.  I consider myself an above average photographer and can make even the worst camera take a decent picture.  Not with this one.  Save yourself the money and the aggravation and get a Canon underwater camera.  It is far superior in every way....above and below water.

Reviews.Title: WG-1  Horrible Pictures
Reviews.Author: Frawline
Reviews.Content: I bought the WG-1 to replace the Pentax Optio 80.  The WG-1 has been returned, I hope because it was defective and not just a lousy camera.  Easy to use, yes. Just like the Optio 80.  The pictures were HORRIBLE.  On every possible setting, all outdoor pictures were overexposed.  Blue skies turned green and all other colors were not true.  Red and pink flowers, completely blown out and did not even look like photographs. I am not sure if I should reorder it.  I am waiting for the refund before I make a decision.  But it doesn't appeaer hopeful. Previously, I had told myself I would not re-order any Pentax because their customer service has no sense of urgency when dealing with a customer.

Reviews.Title: Camera Nice but... big problems
Reviews.Author: DB "groovemerchant"
Reviews.Content: As someone who has purchased 20+ cameras over the last ten years and was specifically going to use this camera for adventure travel.. beach, diving, climbing travel I can give you my 10 cents:THE CAMERA SEEMS NICE small packs a lot of features into a small form AND THE past REVIEWS SUM IT UP VERY WELL, however my 2 stars are for the fact that the camera is close to $300 and the battery has incredibly poor life, you need to buy a second battery along with this if you are using it as your main camera.Cons:No USB charging only charging thru a 110/220 wall socketThe Battery charger with 3 foot AC cord is larger than the camera , so when traveling you need to bring a large bulking charging unit with you... no thanks... Its seems silly to make a small portable camera and then have a tiny battery that takes maybe 200 pix (less using the flash) before its drained. The large bulking charging unit is what kills it for this camera. Why not make the charger smaller minus the bulk cord, have the micro USB cord charge the camera from your computer which it does not , plus the USB cord is a MICRO USB cord , not a issue but just another cord to carry around.This camera has no lens protection and is marketed as a rugged unbreakable camera, yes it is that , however drop it on its face or damage the glass lens cover and the camera is useless with a crack or scratch on the lens. As a owner if multiple DSLR and portable cameras this is a FAIL simply for the above reasons. Item returned to AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: worst camera i own
Reviews.Author: anuk
Reviews.Content: this camera takes the worst pictures ever there is no way to get a pic that is not blured / i own 3 other camers nikon/ cannon / kodak all not near as expensive , the pic quality plows this Pentax out of the water JUNK / i will buy my cameras at wal mart

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I don't understand these reviews, I LOVE this camera. My favorite feature is the microscope mode, or the macro mode. The pictures are SO clear and detailed, it's amazing. I was even able to take a super close, clear picture of a spider in a very low light setting. The pictures are also very clear too, the LED's on the front are very helpful.It seems like a lot of these reviews are just from faulty cameras, and I guess pissed off people are more likely to come on here and rate instead of people that are very happy. And for the number of people that buy this camera, just 10 poor reviews doesn't truly represent the camera. If you are considering this camera, do some research in google and people have nothing but good things to say about it. I'm VERY happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Joel Underwood
Reviews.Content: We use ours in a industrial marine environment. They are still going strong and durable. We used to buy cameras every month. Now we have had some of these going on almost 2 years.

Reviews.Title: IS NOT WATERPROOF!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mark K McCreary
Reviews.Content: We were taking our first cruise and planning to have a lot of great under water photos from snotkling and scuba diving. The camera was working great on dry land and on the ship but once we started our first snorkling excursion it wouldn't even turn on. This was only in about 5 feet of water. I was very dissapointed because this was a once in a lifetime trip and I have no pics to show for it. Thanks a lot Pentax POS

Reviews.Title: Pentax optio wg-1

Reviews.Title: 25 cents/photo...13 month lifespan... Just enough to outlast the warranty
Reviews.Author: Wiggles
Reviews.Content: I purchased the younger brother to this camera the Optio W90 which proved to be a decent point and shoot camera when it was working. It was lacking in video department but what do you expect from a cheap point and shoot. The only reason I bought this camera was for the underwater capability, and what do you know a couple weeks after the short 1 year warranty expired the thing breaks on a snorkeling trip. In total I took about 1000 photos on 4 trips, it boils down to almost a quarter a photo. This was the second time I used the thing in the water, the first in pool to test it out. So after my vacation to FIJI, I do not have a point and shoot, no photos of amazing coral reefs and no warranty.I get back and call customer service and they inform me that I can send the camera in and pay for it to get fixed, or they can show me where to buy the WG-1. Why would I pay any more money to Pentax if the camera will probably just break next time it gets wet.I would not recommend buying any of these series models they will inevitably break especially if you use them in the water or in harsh conditions, something they are supposedly designed for, hopefully you will still be in the 1 year warranty window if you do.

Reviews.Title: Great for a waterproof digital camera - if it was 2001
Reviews.Author: John Laiuppa
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading some good reviews and looking at some of the other camera options out there.  I needed a rugged compact that could handle the rigors of beach catamaran sailing, kayaking, and other outdoor fun.I had previously had several Canon point and shoots, and in terms of picture and video quality, menu ease of use and other features, they were great.  Unfortunately, they weren't very rugged, and eventually I would kill each camera, and the nice underwater housing I bought was only good for that model.My experience with Optio-WG1 camera has been decidedly mixed.  I like the housing and overall build, but have not submerged the camera yet, so I don't know if I would get leaking like others have reported.  I did take it out in a raging thunderstorm with 50-70 mph winds and driving rain, worked fine, no water in the housing.On the downside, as others have mentioned, there is no cover for the glass, so if you scratch it, your're done.  I guess a case might fix this, but a slide cover would as well.  Having this on a lanyard implies that you want this readily available, nto in a case.  Not well thought out in that regard.The real downside are teh internals.  The image quality is unacceptible for a $350 camera being sold in 2011.  I used ot get better pictures of my first digital cameras.  I am not sure how having 14 MP of bad image is preferable to 8 MP of decent image.  Part of the isuse might be the autofocus controls, but it could be the sensor itself.  I throught at first it was the LCD quality, but after downloading I realized, no, it's teh image.  There is a ton of digital noise, pictures are unfocused, and although I haven't seen it personally yet, I have heard reports that the color quality is also unreliable.I will return this camera, and try out one of the otehr available options on the market.

Reviews.Title: probably get one or  two years out of this camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel R. Miller "Book heaven"
Reviews.Content: I just got last years waterproof Pentax back from the factory. They said it would cost $100 to fix. After a few weeks Pentax said it was not repairable seem water leaked thru the shutter button. I had great luck using this camera kayaking and hiking but when I actually used it snorkeling it lasted for two days. We ended up renting a camera with an underwater case and the pictures and movies were great. These consumer waterproof cameras for under $300 are not made to last. We met a couple that was on their third Olympus. These cameras do not take the greatest pictures either. If you must own one I recommend not taking taking it more than 4 feet underwater. Limit submersion time. However renting a 800 dollar camera for 50 dollars a week is an option you might consider.

Reviews.Title: jpeg incompatability, mediocre image quality, other stuff
Reviews.Author: Austin J. Kelly
Reviews.Content: i'll lead off with a bizarre problem that's a real killer for me, and I'm curious as to why no other review has noted this.  The manual, and Pentax "customer support" assure me that the camera produces jpegs, and only jpegs.  But my Windowx XP home machine, a Mac, and both of my Linux boxes refuse to load the files, telling me that they aren't jpegs, or they don't start with the right hex character, or the files are corrupt.  They load fine on facebook, and on my Windows 7 work machine.  I've made sure to download the most recent versions of digikam, fstop, and gimp on my linux boxes, and picassa and a couple of other programs on my XP box.  And the included photo software won't load on my XP, telling me that it doesn't like my graphics card, and won't run under WinE on my Linux boxes.  Pentax tells me that I must  have software problems on all my machines <g>. Pentax support, btw, is only available from 0930 to 1830 eastern.  If I can't edit, or even look at, my photos on my home computers the camera is going back.Other issues have been noted by other reviewers.  Picture quality is decent but not spectacular in decent light.  But in bright light, or at dusk, image quality on the automatic setting is pretty crappy.  Underwater images are mediocre.  Mediocre battery life and need an external charger.  Can't cover the lens, which is awfully nerve wracking when carrying it around a lava strewn island.  And the memory/battery cover opens if you bump it the wrong way, which is really nerve wracking when using the camera underwater.  Back it goes.

Reviews.Title: Sinks like a rock--maybe faster
Reviews.Author: David Vanderveen
Reviews.Content: The camera is designed as a waterproof camera, unfortunately, Pentax doesn't tell you that it sinks faster than most rocks...at the end of an 8 mile SUP tour with friends, I threw it to a buddy to have him take some pics and the camera was gone instantly--I've never seen anything sink that fast...there should be a warning. Obviously designed by engineers who've NEVER used it in water. Buy the floating strap.
